Had a great meal here with a friend! I think this would be a great date spot, the chairs were super comfy, the lighting was perfect for a date and felt intimate. My one complaint was the table next to us was a group of 5 and they were taking photos of each other all night with the flash on and were SO loud but that is certainly not the fault of the restaurant - did make me think it could be a good group dinner spot as well. We had the charcuterie board but with no meat, I imagine the meat would have been nice but friend was a vegetarian. Also got the pesto pasta with nice thick noodles that I LOVED the cook and texture of it. We also got the pistachio dessert that was so unexpectedly amazing, I wasn't sure what to expect but it was almost like a thick pudding pistachio bottom with a moist cake on top I think that might have been my fav dish of the night!

I had the chance to catch up with a friend here on a Saturday afternoon for lunch. Since moving to the area I've walked by Bacan and always admired the minimalistic decor on modern vibe you're able to distinguish solely from walking past the restaurant. I couldn't think of a better opportunity than this for a friend who had never been to Williamsburg! We made a reservation beforehand and were seated inside. They've also got outdoor covered seating which is probably ideal on a perfect weather day. When it came time to order we did a few rounds of aperol spritz's accompanied with their diavola pizza (fancy for pepperoni). Overall an awesome dining experience due to attentive staff, good vibes, and tasty dishes!

Incredible atmosphere. My friend and I came to Bacàn simply due to the good atmosphere after a day of walking around Williamsburg, Brooklyn. The food was decent. I felt like the gnocchi could've had a bit more flavor and the bruschetta bread wasn't as fresh as it could've been. However, the service was good and others seemed to be enjoying their food-- so might've just been a one off experience. I liked the music they played and the dim lighting/comfortable seating

Incredible food, even better service. Jet made my girlfriend and me feel at home and took great care of us. He even surprised us with a tiramisu since he found out it was our anniversary. I'll definitely be back and HIGHLY RECOMMEND IT!

The ambience and decor is really cozy and modern but the food is expensive for the reeeaaallly small quantity you get. Although the food tastes good, it's just not mind blowing enough to justify the price.

Came here for a weeknight dinner with my wife. We shared the kale salad, the seared scallops, the cacio e pepe ravioli, and the black squid ink gnocchi. I had a couple glasses of wine including a sparkling Mongarda Prosecco and the Frug Gruner Veltliner. My favorite items were the scallops and the gnocchi. The staff was very amiable. There was one gender neutral restroom which was very spacious.

Went here last Thursday with a friend and had an amazing time! The tapas style menu is so fun to share. We had the suppli, gnocchi, uovo, tartare, polpo and taglioni - everything was so good, would 10/10 order these again.
Really nice ambience, really good food. We got iced coffee, the caprese pizza (fresh mozz and crisp focaccia), omelette (SO good), and burger. Would definitely recommend.

In one fell swoop, this place has overtaken all of our regular spots in the neighborhood. Food is incredible, traditional with a twist. Drinks are delicious and creative. And the vibe is great. Exactly what you need to get a dose of Italy while in the city whenever the urge hits. Phenomenal!
The best bacon egg and cheese sandwich in Williamsburg. Great brunch items.  No long wait like other spots in the neighborhood. Great coffee.

We moved a block away from Bacán and we feel so lucky to have found this place. You're immediately greeted by the warmth yet fun that this place exudes -- they really got it right with the decor and music. The menu is perfectly curated for shareable bites and everything is executed to perfection.  We started with this complimentary squash bite that was unexpected but was delicious nonetheless. Our server was so kind to be considerate of my dairy allergy. The polpo (octopus) was so tasty in a tomato based sauce and the pastas were plentiful and homemade. I ordered the cicchetti (smaller portion) of the pici (pesto pasta) and my partner ordered the agnolotti in the regular portion. The pici was completely vegan! The service was so attentive but what really showed was the passion this team brings to their craft. Perfect for a date night and can't wait to return.

Highly recommend this spot. I went for a glass of wine after a stressful day and felt very at ease. The staff is very charismatic with a gentle manner. The mood is very chill with great music and candles everywhere. A place to feel romantic with good quality food and drinks, even had the pleasure of meeting the owner. Will be coming back soon!
Cozy candle-lit interior, memorably delicious house-made pastas, great rotating wine list, and really friendly and excellent service! So good!

If you can't deal with the line up next door at Devoción, cross the street to Bacàn. We did, and it was a very happy accident!  We'll skip that nasty line up from now on.  Bacan's Americano is  exactly like that perfect cup you remember from your first trip to Italy. Made me realize how I miss a classic Italian roast. If the coffee is this extraordinary, I can't wait to try their food!

Amazing new neighborhood gem. This is the passion project for the two guys who run it. You can feel it in excitement over their menu and wine selection and in how they run it. Best part is they don't do wine by the glass, they'll open amazing quality by the bottle ones for you. Can't wait to go back with a bigger group.
My friends and I came in last minute without a reservation and the staff was so kind and welcoming to accommodate our large group. We had a delicious happy hour.

Confused about why this place has 5 star reviews only. Went here for dinner last night and we waited a bit past our reservation time, which is fine on a Saturday night in New York. I'm surprised that no one offered us a drink menu while we waited, but whatever. Let's get to the food... honestly subpar. The gnocchi appetizer was borderline nasty and extremely chewy. The broccoli dish came with 4 pieces of broccoli lol. And the burrata had some strange fish on it. Burrata and fish - not a great combo. I've never not wanted to finish a burrata dish at a restaurant before. The polenta fries were inedible (they took this off our check which is kind, and we didn't ask for them to do that). And the pasta with pesto sauce was eh, okay. Since there are so many amazing Italian restaurants in Williamsburg - I definitely won't be going back here. Go somewhere else.

Very solid brunch experience. A+ cocktails. The sandwich with bacon and eggs (I forget what it was called) was awesome, the bun was like a fluffy biscuit. Had a toast with truffle Parmesan and poached egg that was great too

Went to this restaurant hoping to find a great spot in the neighborhood. Meatballs are okay, best part of the meal was the pappardelle. Within less than an hour of us being there, they were moving tables to connect to ours - very evident they had a larger group coming in. Not even 30 minutes later they had us get up from our table so they could seat others. Very strange and uncomfortable. Won't be returning.

orange wine was great, started promising. ordered agnolatti cichetti that came literally in 4  small pieces and cold. other warm cichetti we ordered also came at a lukewarm temperature, and everything was too salty! hoping for another visit for a better experience.

This is an excellent new Thai spot! It's a beautiful restaurant and everything I've ordered here is worth raving about - so far I've had the Roti Nam Keang (roti with Massaman curry), Pad Mee Kati (vermicelli noodles in coconut milk flavored with a variety of toppings), papaya salad, peanut dumplings, and crab fried rice. They have an extensive cocktail list, and I LOVE their Malai cocktail - it tastes like a coconut milkshake. I'm gonna keep recommending this place to friends and coming back to try more of their menu. If you like Thai food, MayRee will be a place you want to keep coming back to!

We just popped into place to check it out and our food senses were transformed. What an amazing experience. Food was cooked to perfection: every dish we tried had amazing ingredients and flavors. We absolutely loved it and highly recommend MayRee to anyone who loves flavorful food.

Amazing food - best Thai we have had in awhile! Don't be in a rush, servers working hard but possibly a little short-staffed. Cocktails & appetizers were also great - yummy edamame! Good portions & prices acceptably. Only downfall is the front door getting stuck/being drafty - servers took care of it when they could, but also a poor patron who was close to the door had to keep getting up the close the door & heavy curtains meant to help reduce the draft.
THIS PLACE IS AWESOME. Literally sweetest owners ever, the drinks were the best I've ever had in my life. Got the Paga drink and it was amazing. Didn't eat there but next time I definetly will.

Fantastic Thai food, probably the best that I have ever had. Everything that we ordered was really good. Papaya salad, Pad Thai , Tom yum, Crab fried rice. The atmosphere was really nice as well, would definitely come back. I love this restaurant. Only Mayree Restaurant
Great spot. All the dishes were good. I especially liked the fried taro (appetizer), fried chicken tendons (appetizer), and roti with curry.

Decided to go out of convenience just because it was literally right next door to our airbnb, and wow, was that the luckiest thing ever. I eat a lot of Thai food, and this ended up being one of the best meals of my life. To start, we had the Yum Hua Plee and it was ridiculously good. Similar to Laab, but a bit more unique. Delicious. For mains, we had the Gai Tod Had Yai (fried chicken) which was very good and came with some excellent sticky rice and two very good dipping sauces. We also had the Jor Rang, a coconut milk + shrimp curry which... I am still thinking about the flavor that this had. Indescribably good. And then I also had a Thai Iced Tea, which was the best Thai Iced Tea I've ever had. The ambiance was great, it's a cute little spot, would be great for a date night. They played Asian pop music in a cozy brick-walled space with nice lighting. The service was also excellent, very quick with the servers offering us great recs (everything we ordered was at their recommendation, and they didn't steer us wrong). Unfortunately, we were the only people in the place on a Friday night, so I'm hoping that this place can hang on long enough for other people to discover what a hidden gem it is. Every facet of our experience was perfect, best meal of the year for me!

My husband and I decided to try this new Thai restaurant and it did not disappoint. Very friendly staff. The drinks were great. The food was also very good and authentic. They have a tasteful decor with cool ceiling and traditional headdresses displayed in the walls. It's one of our favorite dinner spots now. Will definitely be coming back.

I love trying new places as well as eating at old favorites.  I stopped in MayRee to check it out. Let me keep it brief. Not only is MayRee the best Thai restaurant I've ever been in, (I love Thai food and I've eaten at scores of them!), but in my opinion it's the best restaurant in the whole city. I keep going back and it just keeps blowing me away it's so great! I've never been to another restaurant where every single meal is fantastic. The decor is super cool and the service and staff is exceptional. Do yourself a big favor and try MayRee, you'll be very glad you did.
Great service even better food. They gave an aray of Thai food. Some of the best i have ever had

We've worked area Thai restaurants over and this is our solid favorite.  Absolutely delicious larb & the fried chicken is probably the best I've ever  eaten.  Cocktails are excellent!  They've been open only 2 days - we love it and will go back every week.

Noticed MayRee while walking through the neighborhood, and was enticed by the "not your everyday" Thai menu and cozy interior.  The steamed fish balls had a wonderful bouncy bite, the fried tendon was perfectly crispy outside and delightfully chewy inside, and the kua kling was full of complex flavor and heat--I couldn't put my fork down!  Finished with delicious and heat-quenching coconut ice cream and a cooking pandan-infused gin and cucumber cocktail.  Everyone on the staff was amazingly warm and welcoming.  Excited to go back here again and again until I exhaust the unique menu, and then start from the top until they change up with the seasons.

This place is new and it's well deserving of 5 stars. The food and drinks were amazing, everything was cooked well and tasted unbelievable...if you're thinking of a good thai place to go to in nyc..this is it.

This small and crowded place seems to be a neighborhood favorite. Service is terrific and courteous, wine is drinkable...BUT the pasta we ordered came with a heavy-handed tomato sauce (we had the spaghetti Bolognese and over-cooked artichoke ravioli) and the mixed salad was no big deal. Prices are reasonable so you won't invest too much if you need a bite after seeing a movie at the Quad across the street or hearing music at the New School a few doors away. My friend and I aren't tempted to return.

Came here for a late lunch on Sunday with a reservation. We were seated immediately and served with the complimentary bread and olives. The bread was super fresh! It came with a house sourdough and some focaccia, so good! For our mains we ordered the Margherita flatbread and the truffle and mushroom Fettucine off the lunch menu. The truffle pasta was definitely our favorite! So rich and flavorful and you can tell they make their pasta fresh in house. The flatbread was good, wish it was a little crispier, but nevertheless it was good. I would 100% come back for the pasta, it was really really good. We ended our meal with some complimentary biscotti and cream from our waiter. Overall definitely recommend this place for their pasta! I will be back :)

Could've just been an off day or bad selection on my part but I'd be happy to come back and have another meal!

Da Andrea is a good go to neighborhood Italian restaurant.  It is pretty consistent and offers has a cozy ambiance. I find the servers generally very friendly and pleasant and the service is good.  For the food they have a number of stand by dishes but sometimes their specials are worth exploring. There is a fun little bar area.

Came here Friday night at 7 pm and had a great time. Had the octopus appetizer which was great - a nice smoky flavor that wasn't too salty with a nice mix of veggies. Also really enjoyed the pappardelle which had a classic ragu sauce that was lovely. Lastly, tried their tiramisu which I thought had too much cheese but was otherwise OK. Finally, I will say that the restaurant is quite crowded and cramped. It's fine for adults but a bit challenging for bringing kids and strollers. Still, I really enjoyed the experience and would come back again for the food and the warm and cheerful service.

I would give it another opportunity, though, as the rest of my party enjoyed their food, or they seemed to like it. There's also a lot of interesting food on the menu.

We are in the outside with 15 degrees. The food would not stay hot for long but the pasta was so fresh and flavorful that we didn't let the cold deter us from eating it hot
Amazing food & wine! Not to mention, they were super accommodating of our dog on a busy night. This will no doubt be a new go-to for us - thanks again for the great service.

My boyfriend and I are obsessed with this place. We've been here so many times and have never been disappointed. Sasha was our server today and he was amazing! He constantly made sure we had what we needed.We got our favorite appetizer, the pappardelle, and the filet, all of which were delicious. We also got a free dessert and it was the best Tiramisu i've ever had! We will of course, be back!

Was looking for a quick meal with friends on a frigid night and walked past Da Andrea which was just so cute with the hanging flowers, etc... Inside it was pretty full, but so warm and cozy and I crossed my fingers that we could get a table - and we did!!  And I'm so happy they could fit us in!!  The food was fabulous!!  I ordered a cocktail with a few "alterations" and the bartender came over to check on me to see if it was to my liking. My request was apparently lost in translation from the waiter to the bartender, but he insisted on taking it back so he could fix it! And it was perfect! I wish I had written this review right after I ate there (the last Monday in November), but all I remember is that everything we ordered was fantastic! And the service was superb.  I will definitely return!

My first dinner in New York was at this restaurant and it was a perfect welcome to the city. The food was delicious. The waiter was a little pushy and tried to rush our party but he was super friendly and very helpful. The outside seating area was beautiful and led to the perfect atmosphere throughout our meal. I loved the food but it was also very expensive per portion. One pasta dish a person should be enough. Their cocktails were really good as well. Overall a very fun, atmospheric, delicious restaurant that I would recommend if you want Italian food and are in its area.
Good ambience, a very cute brunch place thats really more about the aesthetic than the food.
No comment

I hate to leave a bad review for a restaurant I've been going to for years, but the new management has me questioning my longstanding loyalty. I've never felt more rushed or inconvenienced than the past couple of times I've come to eat at Da Andrea. Have the owners lost the art of dining? There's more to eating and leaving a restaurant. Let your customers enjoy a conversation with their company. Let us take our time. Let us enjoy our food at our own pace. If I want to be rushed, I'll get, "fast-food."
Excellent service.  The food was amazing and we got a great seat in the back that was super cozy. We loved our meal and experience tonight! Highly recommend!
Great food, great atmosphere, and great staff! We were there on a Saturday and they had a live musician, who was great as well. Definitely recommend.
No comment
I got the Ravioli di Noci and it was great, would recommend - service was super fast and the restaurant has a great ambiance.

Maybe I'm not used to eating at fancy restaurants but I came here on a date and was shocked at the portion size. The food is so tasty, definitely get outdoor seating if you can! Everyone is very kind and the decorations were so pretty.
No comment
I had the cavatelli & it was delicious! Great service, fresh food, good vibes. Would come again
No comment
No comment

I went there on a date and Da Andrea did not let me down. The setting, the food and the service was something I did not experience before. The food came out in minutes, the staffing were so welcoming and the setting was fantastic. We went there at dawn and overall my experience with Da Andrea was perfect. I recommended Da Andrea to my family and friends.
No comment

Great place! Fun environment! Friendly staff! Inside is a bit loud so if you don't like noise you'd be better off sitting outdoors. Honestly, the outside is beautiful and the pictures are not deceiving whatsoever. Nicolas was our server and if you go there, honestly, i'd recommend you go there. He's so friendly and checks up on you so you don't have to worry about chasing your waiter down. The stuffed chicken breast was great and so was the dessert. We got cranberry juice as drinks and it really tied together our meals. Do not hesitate to try Da Andrea!

This was such a delicious Italian dinner. We were able to get a reservation day of, and sat outside which is pretty! Bread was great and I got the cavatelli de ricotta which had shrimp salmon and pesto, would recommended. Aperol spritz was great as well.

Such good food! Marco was very attentive and checked up on us multiple times. My party was a little late getting here, but they were super accommodating and let us wait at the table until the everyone showed up. The mimosas tasted so fresh and the flatbread was so delicious. The eggs were perfectly poached for my eggs benedict! I would come back again for brunch!
No comment

I am not a pasta person but my friend is so she added this to our must try list and I'm glad that she did. We decided to be greedy and get some of everything. We started with the mussels which were great; I wish it came with more bread to dip in the delicious sauce but we saved some of the house bread for it. Next, I had the Ravioli di vitello and my friend has the Gnocchetti di patate which were both great. We shared the Involtino di pollo (stuffed chicken breast) which was not my favorite. Lastly, the Triangolo al Cioccolato (chocolate cake) was excellent. It's VERY decadent which is a pro and a con so definitely share it and understand that you might not be able to finish it all, especially if you ate a large dinner beforehand like we did. The space is nice; I'd recommend for a date night and the outdoor space is lovely. I sat inside this time but hopefully I'll get to sit outside next time.
Great dinner experience! There are a variety of pastas and the service was great! Our server Marco was very attentive and had good recommendations for our table

Da Andrea was one of the few best experiences I had in a NYC restaurant. The review they have is not a scam. The staffs are the sweetest and extremely friendly. They made sure we were doing okay and kept very attentive. The atmosphere was also great and the interior is beautiful. The food was delicious as well. we had the squid ink pasta and the spicy eggplant pasta (sorry I don't recall the names). Along with the food and the friendly experience, I highly recommend Da Andrea!

The service was excellent! I finally found a good Italian restaurant to eat at in NJ/NY. That limoncello at the end really hit the spot. The service was excellent.  I had the Ravioli Di Noci, oh Lord that was delicious, and seriously I wanted more! For dessert, we had Triangolo al cioccolato  and Tortino di Ricotta, every bite was sweetly delicious. For drinks, the wine selection they had at the time was excellent.
Sarah and Marina are very accommodating! Food are great and authentic. I would highly recommend this place. Ambience and live acoustic music are perfect combo !

This restaurant is by far the best addition to the Village in years. I live right next door, and when I say that this place is MOBBED every weekend and on many weeknights, I am not exaggerating. I not only appreciate great food, but the service is amazing. The food is served with professionalism and great pride in what it looks like; sometimes I don't know whether to eat it or hang it in a picture frame. Great ambiance, intimate setting and all-around a pleasant and delicious dining experience. Be sure to make a reservation whenever you go, because tables fill up quicky. There's an outside space, as well, with heaters if you go for that; you are not second-class diners out there, be certain of that!
No comment

We dined outdoors here on a lovely summer evening. The service was impeccable, the food was sublime, and the entire experience was exceptional. I had the salmon, and my daughter and friend had pasta dishes, and everything was beautiful presented and delicious. It's definitely the best meal of our trip, highly recommended!

Came with a reservation for 3 and got seated as soon as the entire party was present. This spot is packed and very busy. Service was friendly, attentive, accommodating. We had the pappardelle, spinach ravioli, fettuccine with egg plant and spicy tomato sauce, tigelle modenesi con prosciutto, and a sparkling strawberry drink. Of all the dishes, I recommend the spinach ravioli, and the pappardelle second. The fettuccine had a rough texture and lacked flavor. The appetizer was also tasty with the thin round breads where we placed the prosciutto, cheese, and veggie inside for a nice bite. The sparkling strawberry also lacked flavor, but for those that like sparkling drinks, you'll probably enjoy. Overall, spent $120 for 4 dishes and a drink, which wasn't bad but solid spot.

We were there for my 36TH birthday. This was our first time, but we'll definitely be returning. The food was amazing and so was the atmosphere and service. We had a reservation at 9 and reached earlier. We were seated almost right away. Our server was great as well!
Love the food here! Fresh pasta and our waiter was super nice!! I recommend getting their plates with their fresh pasta! I got the carbonara and it was SO good! Very cute place!
No comment
No comment
Just lovely! The staff & food were great- nice & cozy atmosphere. We will definitely be back!

My family and I had a reservation at Da Andrea for our first night visiting New York. We were greeted by the beautiful flowers and lights outside and fell in love with the elegant atmosphere. However, checking in with the host was a bit chaotic since the restaurant was busy. There were a lot of other patrons waiting and the host was feverishly running in and out of the door. Once we got his attention, we were seated within a matter of minutes though. The food was delicious and came out promptly. We ordered the grilled calamari as an appetizer, and then had the pappardelle, squid ink tagliolini, and cavatelli as our mains. The standout was definitely the pappardelle; it was made with truffle oil. Overall, a great dinner spot - I recommend making a reservation if you plan on going though.

Absolutely fabulous Italian Restaurant with romantic setting, even the outdoor, street setup. Started with the Carpaccio, fantastic appetizer. Shared dinner with my lovey, the Pappardelle w/sausage, and the Zuppa di Pesce, both were cooked to perfection. Highly recommend if you're around Chelsea or the Village

I had my birthday dinner here and loved the ambiance. The beautiful summer setup included a pink floral canopy over the outdoor tables (see pics). Service was great and the food was solid. I was not in the mood for pasta, so I ordered the lamb shank with saffron risotto - it was delicious. The staff was kind to sing happy birthday when they brought out my dessert. Overall, enjoyable experience here. Do make a reservation!

Great experience! We didn't have a reservation and didn't have to wait too long at all, although I would definitely recommend reserving ahead of time. We got some of the popular pasta dishes and they were amazing! I especially liked the pappardelle. Our server: Sasha, was amazing!! He recommended an amazing red wine and even brought us free biscotti to go with our espresso martinis. Can't go wrong with this place!

Excellent service. Everyone from the host to the waitress to busser were fabulous. The meal was delicious and the perfect portion amount. Don't skip the dessert either! My table stayed after we paid to chat and we received complimentary espresso martinis and were not rushed at all unlike most  restaurants in nyc. Can't wait to return.

Beautiful outdoor seating but you will  need to have a reservation to get be seated outside.  We were there mid-week around 6 pm without a reservation and were able to be seated inside.  However, There were no empty tables by the time we got our food.  We were seated by the bar where the one bartender was quite busy mixing all kinds of interesting looking drinks.  I had a glass of Pinot Grigio which was served well chilled just as I like it.  Pastas we're house made so I ordered the spaghetti bolognese $24. The pasta was cooked just right; the sauce was okay.  My husband had the grilled chicken $25 which he enjoyed.  We asked for some bread which was served with excellent olive oil for dipping.  Prices were quite reasonable for the area.  I wish there was a little bit more bolognese sauce in my spaghetti.  The veggies that came with the grilled chicken tasted quite fresh and also cooked just right.  Overall a nice dinner.
No comment
No comment

Cutteeesstt Italian spot! We visited here during our trip to NYC and I'm so glad we did! With so many Italian places in the city, I'm glad we stumbled upon this one. Reservations are really easy and we sat inside because it was a hot day. It's a super busy restaurant but plenty of staff and our waiter was very attentive. The food was amazing and my favorite was the tiramisu for dessert. I recommend to all if you are in NYC!
Nice place to eat at any time. Pasta lovers will love it. They have a lot of pasta on their menu. Service was great. Offered specials throughout the day.

Love this beautiful place! I went there for brunch and dinner, and I personally think brunch is better. Especially during summer time, there will be flowers arch outside. Enjoy the beautifully flowers while chatting with friends!

I saw this restaurant on social media and my husband took me on a date here. First of all, the outside is decorated so beautifully with pink flowers and hanging light bulbs so it's picture friendly. The food selections were great too. The portions were perfect because they were filling despite the bowl size. The person who stole the show and gave us a great time was our server, Sasha. He was absolutely knowledgeable, friendly conversationalist and overall amazing. I cannot stress how generous and gregarious he was. My husband and I got along with him instantly and I saw that he had that effect on everyone. Please stop by if you haven't! Great food, great atmosphere and AMAZING staff. THANK YOU SASHA!!!!

reallly nice decor outside and warm bistro vibes inside! i'd say the food was pretty good too! pastas definitely tasted handmade and had a good texture. i think the ragu one was good? squid ink was lacking flavor

The ambiance is beautiful for sure, especially the outdoors. But the food did not quite complement the decor. The bread they served us was not even warm. I asked for my salmon to be cooked medium rare when I ordered the Filleto di salmone, but it was almost a medium-well. The Paillard di pollo had overcooked chicken too - it was tough, not juicy and simply relied on the sauce and seasonings. The desserts were too sweet. Had higher expectations.

The place has a beautiful outdoor seating area which reminds you of Italy. The food is amazing, very fresh and good portion. We tried the cavatelli a la bolognese, the fettuccini al tartuffo and the salmon. All three plates very delicious. We also received complimentary  bread with olive oil and a dessert. The service was amazing too all of them were very attentive specially Melannie. Highly recommend this place.

Beside food arrived lukewarm,I ordered Tagliolini al nero di seppia alle vongole e pomodorini ciliegia - (squid ink) are flavorless food tastes extremely bland tried 3 pieces calms is more like I'm chewing sands straight from beach. Other dish were just okay-
I like the food a lot and people were friendly. We went for celebration as staff were there to sing happy birthday song and serve the dessert. I enjoy the seafood and pasta a lot. Would go back!
No comment

Service is great but the seatings are very uncomfortable. We seated very close to the next table and right in front of kitchen entrance and walkway just see many people passing us. Food is okay maybe we didn't order their best dishes - lamb and steak are a little bit blend lack of seasoning. I wouldn't come here during holidays or on a date it's way to crowded and not comfortable.
Delicious food, great service, comfortable and homey atmosphere. I wish I could somehow get the truffle mushroom pasta delivered to my house in Texas!  Would visit again!
The complimentary focacia and olive bread was so fresh. Great service. Super attentive. The meatballs,  branzino  ,pasta amazing!!
Great dinner spot. Food & service was excellent. Waiter even informed us there was a big dinner party and got our order in before theirs so we didn't have to wait
Food was fair, service was really good. A very cute date night spot, with a beautiful ambiance.

Based on Yelp reviews, my wife and I made a reservation for 5pm last Sunday, and met our nephew, my 94-year old mom, and my cousin for dinner, and...WE F'N LOVED IT. First time there. From the moment we arrived the staff was cordial and understanding, and they really catered to my mom. Moreover, the food and drink were awesome. My mom ordered veal and FINISHED THE WHOLE THING! Nothing left on her plate. Can't remember the last time that happened. I had chicken and did the same, and everyone raved about the food and vino. We will be back, and soon. THANK YOU DA ANDREA for over-delivering!
No comment

I really did enjoy this place. I had an early dinner here with my friends after a day of ice skating. I would say I felt a bit underdressed but nonetheless I had a good time. I would advise making a reservation because it seemed as if my friends and I had not made a reservation we would have been seated somewhere not a pleasant as where we sat. The star was very helpful, I wouldn't say they were super attentive in the beginning but granted we got there at around 3:30 so the after lull was just coming to an end. Our waitress was very helpful in explaining the menu to us. We order the flatbread for the table which that day's special called for cheesy Margherita flatbread *chef's kiss*. My one friend and I proceeded to order the spaghetti alla carbonara and my other friend ordered their cavatelli di ricotta. All was delicious. The cavatelli had pesto and I'm telling you it was blended to perfection. My first time trying pesto could never be beat. 4/5 for the sole reason we didn't get dessert, ... that was until they gave us complementary biscotti cookies with a lovely sweet sauce. 4.5//5, great place for an intimate lunch or date night with you partner

First time in NY with my boyfriend so I thought I had to have some Italian! I loved the decor outside and the low lit ambiance inside. Seating is a bit tight and the patio is on the sidewalk, but I really didn't care because the food was phenomenal. Must try!

The waitress was incredibly friendly and helpful. The pasta was amazing and fresh! Great pricing for the wine and  have a big selection to choose from. You must make room for the crème brûlée because it was delicious. Definitely make a reservation but be warned that you cannot be seated until your entire party is there.
No comment

Got the flat buns app, zuppa di pesca and spaghetti for entrees. The buns were good, bread was fresh baked. So simple and good. The soup was amazing. Pasta was pretty good too. Nice vibes, super cute location. 2nd time here and won't be my last!
No comment

Returned after a number of years and it's just as good as I remembered. Straightforward but good pastas with excellent vegetable sides. Service was friendly and prompt despite the hectic evening. Great neighborhood place.

Beautiful restaurant and amazing food! For drinks, we ordered Capri (refreshing and delish). For appetizers, we ordered the calamaretti alla griglia (grilled calamari) and burrata con basilico. The cavatelli di ricotta was so delicious and portion sizes were great. There were chunks of salmon and shrimp. Highly recommend this spot for a girl's night or date night
No comment

column3: Central Oklahoma City, Oklahoma City, OK
column6: Da Andrea is one of my favorite restaurants in NY! The Aesthetic gives you an authentic NY feel! They have traditional receipts and also vegan options so there is something for Everyone. Marco and James our servers were patient and kind. The manager Sidy  made sure to accommodate us without reservations and the bartender Andrew crafted seasonal cocktails!
No comment

This was the perfect spot for a mid week dinner with the girls. The outdoor space is so beautiful and there is plenty of seating. The pasta special was fantastic and the Pappardelle was a go to classic! Love this spot and will definitely be back

Extremely good carbonara with free foccacia and what I'm assuming is olive bread? Sit outside if the weather is nice! The pasta is a perfect cooked slightly more than Al dente which is how I like it and the food came out extremely quickly. Good for a date night or right before a show!

Cute exterior with the lights and the flowers decorating the outdoor seating area! There's a nice ambiance inside, service was great, everyone was attentive. I got the gnocchetti di patate and it was delicious. The gnocchi was soft and pillowy, the gorgonzola sauce was creamy, the arugula brought in some freshness and acidity that helped balance the dish from feeling too rich and heavy.  My friend got the tagliolini neri alle vongole and she loved it, finished the entire plate. We shared the tortino di mele (apple tart) it was good, not too sweet and tasted fresh. Def going to go again!
No comment
It was a cozy fun environment, the sectionals of food was phenomenal! So many choices to pick from! The place was welcoming and funny. I suggest everything!
No comment

This place was super cute and I loved the outdoor seating! I got the squid ink pasta with clams and garlic white wine and it was 10/10 but I wish the portion size was bigger. Did not feel full after finishing the meal. Another downside was the service - had to wait so long just to order and we did not even get our bread until after we asked.

i've been here a couple times now and they have all been great experiences! it's usually quite crowded at night so make a reservation in advance. my go-to is the cavatelli di ricotta for pasta and the panna cotta for dessert. my friends and family have tried other dishes as well and said they overall enjoyed it thoroughly. the ambience is great and the service was also friendly. look forward to coming back!

Had a pleasant date night at Da Andrea with delicious Italian 3 course meal, selection of wine, and pleasant ambiance of flowers and candles. My partner and I love Italian food and saw that the restaurant is a must-go for a pasta lovers. We made a reservation a week prior, so definitely recommend making one before showing up as lunch and dinner hours can get pretty packed both indoors and outdoors. Although the service was somewhat slower than preferred, the food and our waiter made up for it :) we ordered tigelle with prosciutto and Parmesan cheese which is a round bread with an outer crunch and soft in the inside. Like a fancier English muffin for reference lol. Basically, you take the tigelle and throw slices of prosciutto and some cheese and bite. It was delicious! The main course we shared the spaghetti bolognese (spaghetti was so gourmet and sauce was perfectly seasoned) and stuffed chicken with ham, spinach, cheese, and outer puff in a gravy sauce. We also shared 2 glasses of Sauvignon blanc and apple tart topped with vanilla bean ice cream which was so buttery and sweet! Overall, excellent meal and highly recommend!
No comment

When my friends and I came here for brunch, we were discriminated against because my friend had a service animal. In New York, service animals ARE allowed in restaurants. The restaurant refused to seat us. The manager wasn't in, but one of the employees told us that the manager would not allow any dogs into the establishment. My friend who had the service called 311, who then called the cops. NYPD came and explained to the restaurant that they need to seat us. We were finally seated, but when we ordered and they brought out food, the staff literally asked us every minute if they could take away our plates but we were clearly still eating. It felt like they were trying to force us out and kick us out... My friend's service animal was very well behaved, quiet the whole time, and we sat in a corner by the door too so she wasn't close to any guests. There was one waitress who was polite to us, but all the other staff we interacted with were extremely rude.
No comment
No comment
Amazing date spot with delicious homemade noodles and layers of flavor. Our favorite meal of our trip!

Made reservation for dinner at 8pm after a day of exploring NYC.  We happened to get there a hour early and they were nice enough to get us a seat right away.  Service was amazing and food was delicious.
Come come come amazing place to visit especially for a romantic dinner I love this place so much !!!

What a cute spot. My son and I came here for lunch. The mussels were spot-on, flavorful broth and plenty of bread for dipping. I got an omelette - lovely - and he got bolognese (very tasty). Aside from being a little short handed on a busy Saturday (what restaurant isn't these days?) it was an absolutely perfect experience.
No comment

Looking for a restaurant with a great ambiance and flavorful food?! I thoroughly enjoyed my experience at Da Andrea. I tried the squid ink pasta stuffed with salmon special and it was so flavorful. I have never tried a pasta with so many different flavors with every bite. The classic caesar salad was really fresh and better then most restaurant salads as well. Definitely would return again with family and friends visiting New York City!
Beautiful place, delicious food! Warm octopus salad was delicious, as well as veal ravioli and Ricotta Cavatelli with Shrimps, Salmon and Pesto Sauce! Definitely coming back to this place!

I'm from out of town for work and needed a nice place to read my book and enjoy a glass or two of wine! This place was PERFECT! The patio was so charming and Nicholas was outstanding and was very attentive but also never rushed me as I was nose deep in my book. I got the carpaccio and carbonara and both were amazing and very authentic. All of the staff were very diligent and I will be back again!
Very average restaurant. Pasta was supposed to be fresh but didn't taste like it. Would not go back.
No comment

No comment

Ever have to call the police to have brunch? Well it was a first for me too. I have a service animal which people automatically assume is "fake" because I am not deaf or blind or they cannot "see" my disability. It is against the law in New York to only allow service animals for the blind or deaf as well. The staff demanded an ID for the dog which does not exist in New York State - I would know I'm a lawyer. I tried to calmly explain this and even showed them the specific law on the government website as well as the requirements which are required I show - which I did. Still, they insisted the manager who was not there, would not allow it. So I had to call 311 who then called the police for me who came and explained the law to them. We were able to sit and have brunch finally. We ordered we were eating slowly and chatting, my service animal sitting right under me not making a sound. Every two minutes staff came and asked us if they can take away our plates which we were clearly still eating. I never felt so rushed and it was as if I was getting kicked out. I would never ever recommend this place until they get some training.

The food was amazing. I had a pear Gorgonzola salad and the Zappa de pesce. The staff was attentive and kind and my waiter, Sasha, was wonderful. I treated myself to dinner for one and Sasha took such good care of me that it felt like having dinner with an old friend. Highly recommend!

One of those consistent Italian m spots you can bring any family member, date, or friend group to. We made last minute reservations on the weekend no problem for two people. Food was fresh, bread was good and drinks were tasty!
No comment

Had an amazing dinner while in NYC. The restaurant is small but lovely, even the outside patio.  The services was good and the staff were super friendly. I made reservations thru Yelp which was very helpful. I ordered their Zuppa di Pesce which was an amazing thick seafood soup! Love it. My family ordered pasta and they all really enjoyed their dinner. We topped it off with dessert Triangolo Al Cioccolato which was the perfect ending to my daughters bday dinner. I was so happy we were able to find this gem.
No comment
Amazing food, service, and great aesthetic! Look no further for a great brunch spot in nyc!

I came here with 4 other people for a group dinner on Saturday night and the food, service, and ambiance was amazing. I would totally go back and I highly recommend this for both a date night but also a group dinner.

Had such a great time this past weekend with two girlfriends from college! Great food, great atmosphere, and great drinks! Just a little pricey for pasta dishes but the food is great and the overall service was amazing so we didn't mind.

Great ambiance! My family and I sat outside underneath the patio filled with flowers and lights. The service was very attentive and professional. Our wine and dishes did not disappoint! I personally had the squid ink pasta which was very fresh but had an underwhelming flavor as a whole, compared to my family members dishes. I'd recommend to anyone looking for an intimate delicious evening! Reservations are highly recommended due to the noticeable popularity of the restaurant.

Such a cute little restaurant for a brunch date with the girls or for a date night. The outdoor seating is filled with flowers which makes it a very aesthetic photo op. All the severs were extremely attentive, the atmosphere inside was rather cozy, and the food matched the price tag. I ordered the mushroom truffle risotto which was the special of the day and I wasn't utterly wowed. The rice was a bit harder/stiff for my preference and the flavoring was quite intense hence I got tired of my meal in four bites. I decided to give this place a four star because it could've been my taste buds fault as all my other friends enjoyed their meal! The highlight of my meal was the complimentary cookie that they give at the end. The sauce paired with that cookie found the fine line between decadent and light, it was amazing.

I could not have asked for a better place to celebrate my thirtieth birthday today. We were seated outside beneath climbing flowers and treated to exceptional service by our waiter Afzan. Group consensus: the highlight dish was the special truffle risotto, but you can't ignore the Penne with zucchini, the Pappardelle, and espresso martinis. Could not recommend more. Afzan brought out a birthday dessert for no extra charge! Very thankful for the experience; thank you Da Andrea!
Food was great! Carlos was a good a waiter! Really great specials offered as well. Drinks were yummy as well!
Friendly staff and delicious pasta! I was satisfied with my squid ink pasta dish.  Their bread appetizers were delicious too

Amazing food!! The entire staff is extremely kind and welcoming.  I've been coming here my entire life and am always happy to return. I would give more stars if I could! Try the calamari if you get the chance!!

Came here for my husbands birthday with our 8 month old and had a lovely dinner! staff was so nice and patient, even though our waiter had to repeat the specials twice because our baby has discovered his voice, with no volume control lol. Food was delicious, ambiance is cozy, wine was yummy. Nice date night spot maybe after next time I leave the baby with the grandparents
No comment
No comment

Stopped in for a quick late lunch. The mussels were on point. A garlicky, spicy (kinda smoky too) tomato broth that made for a delicious soup. They give you focaccia that's crusty for dipping. The mussels were plump and not gritty. Just nice with a glass of Italian white. The pesto was very mild and creamy, unlike what I'm used to. Sitting outside on a spring day was great too
Fantastic food, attentive but not overbearing service, comfortable atmosphere, and as a bonus great desserts.

This place is super cute! They even have a guy singing live. We made reservations and we got there and requested outdoor seating. We picked our own seats and told the waiter. We got seated and had no menu for over 10 min. They seated another table next to us and brought their menus right away. We had to ask for a menu. They also serve bread with oil. When we got the bread with oil, they didn't give us any plates so I had to ask for it. Then, when the guy put the plate down there was food stuck to it. It was a dirty plate so I told him and he just replaced it right away without saying sorry or anything. The service at this place was HORRIBLE. I'm not sure why the place has 4 stars. We ordered eggs Benedict and blueberry pancakes. The salad with the eggs Benedict barely had any dressing on it. The Benedict was nothing special and neither were the blueberry pancakes. It was probably the worst meal I had in my stay at New York.
No comment

Great place, great atmosphere inside seating or out. A lot of flowers outside. The food is perfect! Authentically Italian BEST PANNA COTTA EVER! our server James was very hospitable and knowledgeable about the dishes and the wines as well
Gorgeously ambiance, delicious food and excellent service. HIGHLY RECOMMEND! Every single entree, appetizer and dessert we had was delicious
Very very busy on an Easter Sunday, but service remained very attentive (thanks, James) and meal was excellent.  Forgot to take pics of the appetizers - but try the Popoli.

The parpadelle with lamb ragu was delicious.  Pear, gorgonzola and arugula salad was good but tiny for $18. The Margherita Flatbread was bland and the crust had slightly undercooked taste (definitely not worth the $19). Lovely outdoor seating area and live music, attentive and friendly service.  If eating here, go with the pasta

Came here when visiting some friends for cocktail hour. The scenery is gorgeous and I definitely recommend sitting outside if you can! There are beautiful flowers and vines everywhere! We had drinks and gelato and it was absolutely delicious! The wine and cocktails are amazing. The gelato is out of this world! Our waiter Carlos was incredibly attentive and wonderful! I will definitely be coming again. We had an excellent time! Cheers to our espresso martini shots!

We had the most amazing dinner here! Our server, James was very kind and recommend some great dishes. The pasta was amazing and the espresso martinis were perfect. Loved this spot and we will definitely be back.

Loves the spaghetti carbonara, Lemon flatbread and linguini tartufo. However, my skinny margarita was too sour and wasnt able to drink it.
Cavatelli with pesto was absolutely delicious. The outdoor section is also quite nice.

Came here to celebrate my friends' birthday. The pastas are delicious!! Definitely try the smoked salmon pasta. Marco was very friendly and we'll definitely come back.

Our group of 10 had a wonderful dining experience here over Labor Day weekend. The service was fantastic and everything we tried was delicious! I especially loved the spicy eggplant pasta and the salmon entree. For drinks, I highly recommend the morimoto spritz or espresso martini. I will definitely return!!

column3: Central San Jose, San Jose, CA
column6: Good is good and delicious but be prepared to be hungry haha unless you get one of the meat options . everything is fairly priced especially for a Italian restaurant!!! Would definitely try again ,when I'm new York

Good solid Italian food.  Fresh delicious pasta, good options, good service.  I didn't love the outdoor seating area being the only place you can reserve on Yelp, as it was a little tight and the heat lamps were too hot.  But the food was solid.
No comment
No comment

Da Andrea is a cosy restaurant with great atmosphere and ambience. We sat at a table outside which was pretty nice and airy. The brunch menu has many options. The food we ordered were delicious, especially the mussels. The dessert was wonderful. Our waitress, Melanie, was extremely nice and helpful.

Ambiance is very nice and romantic. The thing is that is not a legit Italian place. On the other hand, food presentation was very nice and I really enjoyed my meal. Staff is very attentive and friendly.

Magnifico! I loved my experience I had here at Da Andrea's! Had a reservation here for my friend's bday and the service AND the food was *muah* Chef's Kiss!  Our server, James, made our experience top notch! Very personable! Thank you Da Andrea's for making our meal unforgettable!

Made a 8:15 reservation. They did honor it.  But we had to wait outside for 15 minutes and it was chilly   When we sat the service was good.  We ordered a Italian Brunello.  When the waiter put it in the decanter.  It has a cracked edge  the radicchio salad special came out wrong.  Then when it was right.  It was So So.  Veal meatballs were good. Mussels were ok.  The pappardelle was So Good.   But even that was kind of wrong.  Menu said it was with sausage and it can  out with beef.  Chocolate cake was good.  But my espresso was served once I was done.  I had a great night.  And I like the place.  But too many missteps
No comment
From the minute you enter this place feels warm welcoming and friendly. The service fast en efficient. The food is divine is 5 stars for me.
Great ambiance and service. Their flowers and outdoor seating are particularly special. Love the duck ragu!!
Very beautiful outdoors. Such a happy vibe. Food and drinks are great as is their service. Very attentive servers.
The food and service he was exceptional! I went back a 2nd time and will definitely be back again!!
No comment

What a beautiful Italian restaurant in the Greenwich Village! Be sure to make a restaurant because this place is popular! Their outdoor dining set up is beautiful and great for photos of you want! I ordered the burrata app and the pesto pasta. Everything tasted fresh and so delicious. Our waitress was also attentive and fantastic! You won't be disappointed!!

The perfect romantic restaurant. Perfect service, attentive and extremely competent. Perfect environment inside. And some of the best italian food in Manhattan. I could not recommend this place more. The spinach and veal ravioli was some of the best ravioli I've ever had.

My friends and I came across this place for dinner on a Tuesday evening. The restaurant was relatively busy for a Tuesday evening but the service was fast and very friendly. The staff was very courteous and always made sure we had enough water. We ordered the lobster salad for the antipasti. For the entree we ordered the zuppa di pesce, the tagliolini, porcini ravioli, and the cavatelli. All the dishes were great and the portions were large enough that all of us were able to share all the dishes and still feel full. For dessert, we ordered the tiramisu and vanilla ice cream. It's a great place for a birthday dinner or special event as well as for a casual weeknight dinner.
No comment

Good food, good atmosphere, and good service. Food was pretty good! We came here for brunch and ordered the burger, mushroom pasta, pennete con salmon, plus a flatbread to share. For dessert we got the panna cotta and apple tart with gelato. It was pretty busy, but the service was still prompt. Would recommend for brunch with friends.

Booked a reservation here after seeing how nice the aesthetic was and the food looked good. Luckily it was exactly as expected! I ordered a Margherita pizza and among the table we shared many plates, everything was up to par and the tiramisu was phenomenal! Our waiter was very sweet and overall we had a great dinner here. Would definitely come back!

We had to wait a bit, due to a mixup on my table reservation, they had me down for outside and we definitely wanted to be seated indoors. Otherwise, It was absolutely fabulous!  Food was fantastic (truly homemade pasta) and the atmosphere was very lively!  The staff was courteous and attentive!  Will definitely go back!

If you like Italian, this is the place to go. Very cozy and homey, with excellent selection of pastas. I ordered spaghetti carbonara and it was cooked exactly as it's supposed to be and the portion was decent. I could honestly eat here twice a day, it's that good. Our server was great and we had an amazing time. Definitely recommend!
Had a great time. Food was amazing. Fast service. We had a party of 4. Tried calamari, burrata, octopus, pastas and fillet minion. All amazing. Will be back.

I have my set fave pasta spots in the city and this place has just joined my list. The service from our waiter Marco, was incredible. I had the bolognese and gnocchi which were heavenly. Be back soon!
Amazing food, attentive staff and great atmosphere.  You must try Da Andrea, you will not be disappointed.
No comment
Everything was perfect!! Highly recommend this hidden gem. Not to miss their floral decor

We had an excellent lunch and really enjoyed the mushroom risotto special. The music playing made us smile - excellent playlist playing all our 80s classics. We also enjoyed the recommendations and chat with our waiter Nicolas. Highly recommend this gem of a spot. And thanks to the staff for making it so special.
Such a cute place to have lunch and/or dinner with a friend or significant other. My boyfriend & I really enjoyed the atmosphere & food!

Amazing food and service! I called to make a reservation on a very nice day so I couldn't make a reservation for 6PM. Ended up selecting 5:30PM time slot. I got the Ravioli Di Noci, and it was one of the best raviolis I've ever had! The service was great, and I would 100% recommend to anyone considering going.

Living in Hoboken, I have had this restaurant on my list to try for years when considering options in the village for dinner, but somehow have always ended up elsewhere. Decided to take my parents to dinner and started with a Hail Mary at Don Angie. Of course that wasn't happening so we walked over here and Da Andrea did not disappoint. Great ambience, super nice and attentive servers. But most important the food, which was fabulous. I find so many Italian restaurants are perfectly fine but not memorable other than they are exactly that, perfectly fine and reliable. The four of us loved our entrees, 2 pastas and 2 entrees, cleaned our plates which rarely happens. Portions were just right, oh and desert was also delish. Sorry I waited so long to try I will definitely be back!
No comment

Came back again this past Easter and was slightly disappointed. I made my reservation through yelp and the yelp notification said that all reservations through yelp would be outside. Given that day was a bit chilly I called the restaurant to see if I'd be able to switch my reservation to be seated indoors. The person that picked up the phone assured me it would be no problem and that my reservation was actually inside anyway. I get to the restaurant and I'm greeted by who I'm assuming is the manager and he started to walk my group to the seating outside. I stopped him and let him know that I had spoke to someone and they assured me that I was being sat inside. He looked at me very confused and said there are no seats and that he would go talk to the woman I spoke to. He comes back to tell me that the hostess claims she never spoke to anyone and never said I was being sat inside????? Safe to say I was pretty annoyed that this person literally lied about speaking to me on the phone but the manager honestly handled it like a champ suddenly found my party a table inside. The restaurant clearly can't function when things get too busy because there was also a celebrity there eating with his family that was also really annoyed about something. Our food took a very long time to come out and since I was already annoyed about the hostess lying  I was pretty disappointed this time around. I still love this place and am thankful for the managers understanding but there definitely needs to be some kind of cap on reservations so that the place doesn't get overwhelmed.
Amazing experience, Nicholas was a fantastic server. Kept us engaged with nice conversation and made it a pleasant experience. The ambiance is 10/10 definitely recommend
No comment
