No comment

We had an absolutely fabulous meal here. We came here with a large group - 8 people. They were very kind and helped seat us inside. We made a reservation day of. Our waiter was very attentive. They give bread to start. There are so many delicious items on the menu, we all had difficulty deciding! I got the carbonara which was so delicious! Maybe one of my favorites ever. So creamy! The gnocchi was also very delicious. Fluffy and in a yummy creamy sauce. The bolognese was good as well. The lamb shank falls off the bone. Really, I don't think you can go wrong with anything here!
No comment

Da Andrea was hands down one of the best Italian restaurants I've been to! The food was unreal. The quality was great. The service was amazing too, they gave us tequila and lemonchello shots and brought out a small dessert for a friends birthday. 10/10 recommend
Excellent Italian food, I had carpaccio, and the ravioli with a creamy walnut sauce. Tried my friends' plates, all the food was quality. Recommend.

I strongly accept Dr. Andrea! When you are in the boogie hall of this beautiful Italian restaurant, you are immediately enchanted by the magic of the Italian garden in summer. Dr. Andrea's place is, but what makes it the best of heart is service. Nicholas and Kabir take care of our party without any difference. Nichols suggested one more bottle of wine, paired with beautifully delicious appliqu :s: carpacio, tuna tartere and tigle. Our basic courses were excellent, especially salmon and ravioli. The desserts were delicious and the espresso martinis were perfect. much more! Nicholas and Kabir elaborated and focused on the best personal services. Mark made our dinner dream come true. The service we received from Dr. Andrea was unparalleled. See you soon.

column3: Downtown Jersey City, Jersey City, NJ
column6: So this outing was more for my girlfriend, her good friend, and her boyfriend. The key to the outing was 'ambience' and this place killed it. Food was fantastic. Drinks (as per my girlfriend) were awesome. All in all it was a great time. The only knocks and you can't really knock the restaurant for it was the noise. It was loud but that's mostly because it was a weekend evening.

This place is a gem! The service was top notch and the food even better. I found this restaurant because it was close to our hotel and highly recommended on Yelp. I'm so glad we went for it because it did not disappoint. This meal was absolutely the best of the trip. All dishes were fantastic and the tiramisu was up there with the best I've had. Great service and great food. I would absolutely return on our next trip to NYC.
This dinner was better than expected. The portions were generous, and everything that we ordered was delicious. The staff was attentive and helpful. On top of it all, the ambiance was lovely.

I can't recall what the rest of my family ordered, or even what I ordered. I just remember that my parents ordered the special salad, which we shared, and it was bland and entirely unremarkable save a few pieces of watermelon. Similarly, the pasta special that I ordered was fine aside from the dry tuna pieces, but it didn't taste any better to me than any other pasta with any other pasta sauce. Finally, the dessert special, some sort of donut, was nice, but not for the cost. This isn't a particularly expensive restaurant, but even then, nothing felt worth the money. It wasn't bad, but it didn't feel great to have gone there.

This was our first time in New York,  and we are such foodies. We saw some cute pictures of this place so we decided to try it out. We were not disappointed the drinks where so delicious and beautiful. We also had the ravioli and papadelle pasta and could tell it was freshly made you can also definitely taste the truffle in the pasta which we loved. Our server Carlos and his assistant where great too! Overall amazing experience. Thanks Da Andrea

DaAndrea is my go to for friends visiting new york! It's got the ambiance, the menu, the service, and overall a good time for you. I have been there a couple of times, and always satisfied by their pasta variety. Their primis are delicious and i've only had one secondi, which was also delicious! Highly recommend and next time you're in the city and you want an experience, DaAndrea is the place to be!
Wonderful quaint place .. Food great. Ambience great. Live music Sunday Brunch. Definitely will be back. Warm Octopus Salad was delicious Lamb Shank was tender and tasty.

We happened upon this delightful restaurant and had had the best ravioli we have ever eaten. Even my critical husband was impressed. My family fought over the last one. Try this place. You won't regret it.
I got the Cavatelli di Ricotta con Gamberi, Salmone e Salsa al Pesto. The pasta was way too soft and the sauce definitely needed salt. The focaccia was good tho.
THIS PLACE IS AMAZING. Great food, wine, live music. Amazing atmosphere. The staff and manager are so nice! Would come back for sure, I want to try everything on the menu :)
Great food and lovely outdoor patio! I don't really have anything else to say other than it was great
Very kind and accommodating service, especially James who checked up on us and answered our questions. Entrees and dessert were also very delicious

The food is good.  The portions are extremely generous.  The outdoor space is lovely.  Most of the staff seemed professional and hard working except for our server who was beyond rude from the moment my husband was I walked up to the restaurant and mentioned our reservation.  If only that had been the worst of our interaction with him.  He told me to hurry up with my appetizer (I'm not a damn vacuum cleaner) he just seemed to want to get us out ASAP but then refused to give us the bill so we could pay.  Eventually we were able to pay with a different employee.  Our "server" kept refusing to get out of our faces so I pulled out my phone and he twisted my arm.  My wrist and arm are still hurting, I have a bruise and it's the morning after.  Real class act.  We're never returning.  I received a notice of complaint from Yelp HQ mentioning exaggeration and that is the only reason I am updating my review with a photo of one of the bruises.

Had an amazing time! Very attentive service, excellent food. I had the penne with eggplants and spicy tomato sauce and it was to die for. Our server Marco was very sweet and provided excellent service. 10/10 would eat here again.

My friend and I loved the atmosphere at Da Andrea. The wine was wonderful. The food was even better. The pasta was some of the best we have ever had. If you're looking for great Italian food, look no further. We enjoyed having the option to sit outside in the heated tent. We also loved all the flowers and lights that lined the outside of the restaurant. The only thing that could have improved was the communication from our waiter. We would ask for things and he would bring out the same thing or other things to tables around us, but seemingly forgot about us. He could have just been busy, it happens. If I am back in New York I would come here again or would recommend to a friend!

Had such a great experience here for my 22nd birthday!! Sasha was my server and he made sure we had everything we needed, including a detailed description of the history of the wine we ordered. Would def recommend everyone to come here!
Great service, ambiance, and food! Seda gives fabulous recommendations and is a sweetheart. Pesto is 10/10 and chocolate walnut cake is AMAZINg

the best Italian food in New York, celebrated my best boyfriends bday here, he loved it so much considering Italian is his favorite food. I've known this restaurant for almost a year, haven't been able to come since I'm not from here. I saw this restaurant with my best boyfriend who was not yet my boyfriend last October, but didn't get to go in. However this time we're back in town, and he's now my best best best best boyfriend and i love him so much and I really wanna take him to here, and celebrate such special moment.
No comment

A great spot for a wine and dine night! Service was okay. Towards the end our waiter was giving us a bit attitude. The food was great and my friends and I had a great time but would probably not revisit after one time.

Loved this restaurant and food and ambiance. BUT the service was phenomenal. Great recommendations, and suggested some edits to our order and encouraged us to mix the pasta with different sauces. We came in the summer and I was overall very happy with the experience. We did sit on the sidewalk which initially was not ideal, but it was absolutely fine and we did not get side checked which I thought for sure would happen LOL.  Would go back!

Came here for brunch. Good and cool spot but I expected more with all of the good reviews from this place. The menu feels too overwhelming to me. They have way too many options in all directions. I guess this isn't exactly a con but it was hard for me as an indecisive orderer. We went with pasta dishes which were above average. However, the outside ambience was great and the flowers/decorations were so cute.
Super fun vibe! Amazing food and staff. Food was delicious and the wine was incredible
No comment
Great neighborhood restaurant.  Delicious food and warm and friendly staff.  A special treat.

We liked the ambiance! The servers were attentive. The Campagnola was delicious but the Tagliolini Neri Alle Vongole (squid ink pasta) was Too salty. It wasn't on the brunch menu but the server asked the kitchen to make one for us, unfortunately it was a disappointment. I had an Aqua Marina salad, it was just so-so, but they didn't skimp on the crab meat. We liked that there was live music. And oh, the flower decor at the outdoor dining area was beautiful and photo worthy. They knew we were celebrating a birthday and gave us a tiny complimentary dessert (how thoughtful) and espresso martinis (maybe to make up for the salty pasta). Either way you should come check them out!!

The cavatelli bolognese is CHEFS KISS. Their portions are so generous, pricing is very reasonable and the service is always impeccable. Inside and outdoor decor is such a vibe. Didn't care too much for the gnocchi that we ordered, but the bolognese here is a must!
My new fave nyc restaurant! Came here for my mom's birthday. Fantastic environment and great service. Everything were so tasty! Our server James was so nice and attentive. Highly recommend!
Best service everyone was so friendly and felt like I was back in Italy. Great wine and food !
Had the Ragu beef pasta and it was so good! There was a live musician playing that set a pleasant ambiance! The waitress serving our table was nice as well
My favorite restaurant in the village! Delicious food. Super cute restaurant! Prices are reasonable as well. Will definitely keep going back!
No comment
No comment
No comment

From the moment you arrive and are greeted by a Christmas decorated walk way between their quaint outdoor eating and the entryway, you know it's going to be a fun night. People were spilling out of the door with big smiles on their faces. Every table was filled and laughter filled the air. Traditional Italian smells coming from the kitchen. We had an 8pm reservation, arrived at 7:45. We were told it would be 20 minutes. At exactly 8:05, we were walked through the restaurant and sat at a great table in the rear of the restaurant. That room in the back has about 10 tables and offers a more intimate setting. Immediately, the impeccable service starts, it's a team waiting style with appetizers and drinks taken by one gentleman, main meal and dessert by another. Waters were filled as soon as needed, food delivered quickly and hot. The food is outstanding. We started with the tasty Burrata con  basilico, then ordered the Spaghetti Alla Carbonara and the Pappardelle with a sweet sausage ragout. All were great choices. We had the Tiramisu, which was light and flavorful and the Italian cheesecake which was a light ricotta base with a sweet lemony flavor. One thing you notice is that they train well, work as a team and management has lots of staff on site to get the food prepared and delivered efficiently. They know they are very popular right now and they are stepping up to deliver a great experience. So good, so beautiful, great service and a must go experience. Book a table now.

Prompt and friendly service and they accommodate us (me and a friend) within 30 min. Of call/notice for a reservation. The inside is loud but it was SUPER BUSY. Overall was a great experience. The food is to die for and wine was selection is decent. The flowers outside gives it a very vacationy kinda feel in the middle of bunch of concrete  and buildings. That one star missing is for the noise level but sucker me WILL go back and will deal with it.

I came here wanting to love my experience but unfortunately I was severely let down. We loved the atmosphere of the restaurant but the service was not great - We waited over an hour to receive our appetizers and the tables who were seated and ordered after us received theirs first. We had to remind our waitress a few times before she brought our dishes out. For our mains, we specifically asked if a dish could be made without pork only to find pork in the dish anyway. We don't eat pork and didn't realize until after taking a first bite which was extremely upsetting. I'm usually very understanding to mishaps - things happen (especially on busy nights), but our waitress didn't seem to be phased in the slightest and offered very minimal apologies or empathy. As our food was rushed we could tell the quality (inc. undercooked pasta!) wasn't there which was an additional shame.
Great performance/price ratio. We loved all dishes, red snapper and creme brûlée were the best
Freshly made pastas with delicious sauces. I had the spinach and ricotta dish that was excellent. We also had a good bottle of wine.
Super fresh and delicious! 10/10 recommend. Marco was a great waiter as well. They made sure our party had everything we need!
Very good food and attention, the place is cozy, perfect for a romantic dinner. I went with my husband and had a great time
No comment

Great food, cool decor. They were on top of the service given how busy this place is and the number of evening reservations they were managing. Even gave us a complimentary dessert for waiting past reservation time.

Located at 35 West 13th street.   A Cozy festive feeling greets you as you walk in the door.  The menu was extensive.   The pasta we ordered was fresh and cooked perfectly.  Service was excellent and attentive.   There is outside seating but we chose to eat inside.  Tables are close together so if that concerns you, try outside which looked lovely as well.  Definitely recommend!
Great food. Nice beautiful place and nice service. I love the past. But they kind rush our table. But anyway we love this restaurant
Excellent food, beautiful outside seating in summer. It's a smaller place on the inside which we love tough to get a table during colder months so please plan in advance. Definitely recommend it.
I went with a big group and they were so helpful finding us a table. Our server Marco was so friendly! Food was also amazing highly recommend the Da Andrea flatbread.
No comment
No comment
Incredible service by Claudia it was a phenomenal weather her customer service was impeccable and looking forward to be back the octopus salad was fantastic!! Thank you Claudia you made my night
The service and food were absolutely amazing! The service from the runners, and waitress made me feel so attended to and care for m. Truly deserving of the 5 stars.
No comment

Server attentive and great specials.  the menu offers many types of pasta dishes all reasonably priced.  Ambiance perfect and nicely decorated with space for comfortable dining.  We really enjoyed our dinner and will be back soon for the outdoor dining experience.

Excellent!!! I had dinner with my daughters here on a weekday evening. The restaurant was bustling with people and a steady flow of diners. We had the best experience. We had reservations so we were seated immediately and asked if we wanted indoor or outdoor. We chose outdoor as their covered patio section was beautifully decorated and the weather was perfect. The evening was amazing, and the ambiance added to the experience. Our server was attentive and had great suggestions. The cocktails, appetizer and entrees were magnificent! I definitely will be back!
Honestly this restaurant is super mid the service was great but food is way overhyped. It's a beautiful place but deff could find better Italian food elsewhere.  Also a bit pricey.
Had a great time here with some friends! Shoutout to Marco who made some excellent recommendations, like the risotto!

Would absolutely come here again -- from the authenticity of the food, to the service, and the atmosphere...amazing! We are Italian food snobs as we've spent a lot of time in Europe and the food here did not disappoint. Recommend you make reservations. We had reservations for 5:30 pm on a Friday and by 6:30, the place was full.
Amazing food! Super friendly waiters. I love the bread there and offered to buy some, but instead they just gave me a bag of free bread to take home!
Outstanding food and service , small inside , but that's what makes it magical.  It's intimate and the food is Nonna quality

Super nice place. There was a large outdoor space and with that having a business lunch inside, we pretty much had the place to ourselves. I had a Spinach Risotto that was on special, and it was amazing. Based on that dish alone, I would be back here if I needed to be in the area again.

The food here is delicious! The restaurant is very cute and the waitstaff is helpful with recommendations. Definitely make a reservation, however we were able to make one last minute and got seated pretty quickly. The outdoor seating is gorgeous too with all the flowers overhead. Since it is small, you do have to talk a little louder and it would not be great for large groups.

Super fantastic meal. I ordered the carbonara my daughter chose the bolognese spaghetti. Dessert was delicious as well. Service impeccable. Reasonably priced for this high service and quality of food!

What an incredible experience at Da Andrea! It was a last minute change of plans and the best experience! From the beautiful lights and ambiance to the fabulous food and service, this place was the top! Sasha took great care of us from cocktails to dessert and the a lemoncello on the house. It was my first trip to NYC and won't be my last!
Marco was such a great waiter! He was very attentive and never did we have to run down for help! Food was exceptional which made the whole experience a 10/10

All dishes were delicious but best of all, we loved Marco. he was a great waiter & we appreciated his hospitality and wine recommendation. We got the pappardelle and cavatelli, as well as the calamari and meatballs. The pork was tender & flavorful. Great experience and would come back again!

Another Christmas Day dinner here which we have been doing for years, this time it was a bit disappointing due to an overcrowded place and server messed up our orders. Main entrees came but not our appetizers, had to send them back . Abdul was able to rectify everything but unfortunately, our night was ruined due to poor service. Noticed that the food that we normally order did not taste the same and mostly lesser in portion, definitely noticed the big difference. Would have loved to let Abdul know but he was busy. We might have to start looking around for other Italian restaurants to go to and discover
Great place and food was amazing! Nice place after walk on 5th avenue. Outdoor seating is fun if you could reserve ahead of time.

There are plenty of "amazing" Italian spots in NYC that are family run and boast reviews, but every time I frequent one of these spots the food id often disappointing. I went on a date to this restaurant at the recommendation of some individuals online as well as some personal recommendations and needless to say I was ecstatic after my meal. I had the Ravioli di vitello and while the portion could have been larger, it was absolutely delicious, everything I could have hoped for.
Highly recommend for dinner! Great service, delicious Italian food, beautiful atmosphere. Sit outside, the outdoor space is stunning at night!

My friend was craving pasta so we found this place on Google. It's a cute and bustling neighborhood restaurant. The warm octopus was cooked to perfection and paired with potato. This might be the best octopus I've had in a while. My roommate got pappardelle with sweet sausage ragu, which was very delicious and we finished the sauce with table bread. I was not feeling pasta so ordered steamed mussels as main, and regret a little. The mussels I have to say was just meh. We had the apple tart for dessert, which was not as good as I expected. The apple filling was a little overcooked and mushy, while the crust was too hard and dry.
No comment
Delicious freshly made pasta and a good menu overall. Had a nice dinner with friends there.
No comment

Won't be going back. Our dinner started off great. I had grilled calamari and my husband had papardelli with sausage for our appetizers. I ordered lamb chops medium rare. Husband ordered filet mignon medium rare. My lamb chops came out well done. I NEVER return food, but they were so over cooked, I couldn't eat them. I wasn't going to pay $44 for over cooked meat. So when I sent them back they told me they had no more lamb chops.   It was their special and it was only 3 pm. So I didn't believe that they had no more and had no entree.  They gave us a free dessert, but I'm turned off and will never go back again.  Poor customer service. Also they rejected our gift card. So there's that.
Great experience for our first night in NY! The drinks, the entrees, and the dessert were all amazing. Love the ambience of the place. Our server was very helpful as well!
They just physically attacked me for asking for my order.the girls working there are just rude and physically aggressive. Worst experience I had in my life.
Servers were attentive and kind. Also handled a rowdy drunk guest in a polite and professional manner

Beautiful, charming eatery in flatiron. Good customer service.  Delicious homemade pasta and amazing crème brûlée.  Descent prices.  Great place for a nice cozy dinner, birthday dinner or a get together with friends.
No comment

Service is wonderful and the food is exquisite! Kale was very kind to seat us without reservation and the food came promptly as we were in a time constraint with our schedule. The Pappardelle with sweet sausage ragu is my favorite The octopus was tender and such a perfect compliment with the potatoes, olives and tomatoes!
Place is a little tight, however, the service and food was decent. Our server was pretty friendly and the host made sure we felt comfortable where we sat. Very cool interior design as well
No comment
Wasn't very good and I do not recommend. Beware, all of these 5-star reviews are a result of a "free" dessert they give you after you give them a good reviews on Yelp. Very misleading...
No comment
This was our worst dinner in a week long visit to the city. Not awful, just very mediocre.  And very expensive. We had much better food at half the price.

Amazing food, they allowed us to get in earlier than our reservation time and the waiter, Sasha was the best of the best, just incredible, always checking on us, making sure we had our refills and just being amazing, on top of fantastic food, would easily come here again!

Not a huge fan of Italian food, but Da Andrea has really good pasta! I recommend trying the Cavatelli Di Ricotta Con Gamberi, Salmone E Salsa Al Pesto (ricotta cavatelli pasta with salmon and shrimp in pesto sauce) super delish. The restaurant itself is pretty small, not to many decoration. They offer outside dining which has a beautiful floral display. It's gets pretty busy after 5pm so if you don't like small places with lots of people, either come early or sit outside. The waiters were pretty nice people.

Yummy!  We are here visiting NY and found this place on Yelp.  The food was fantastic!  I had the veal ravioli and it was so delicious!  I wasn't very hungry and the portion was very generous.  Booboo had the filet and he loved it!   The restaurant is in a great, cute area of NY and the the restaurant itself is so charming!  I would definitely come back!
Great food and  great service. The restaurant has a Great ambience, with live music m.

Great meal, great service, great atmosphere. Party of four, we tried several dishes, and we really liked it. The outdoor seating is charming and we lucked out with a seat in the bay window which was really nice. Friendly and attentive staff. This was a hit.
No comment

Fantastic restaurant run by fantastic people. I took my girlfriend here for our anniversary & it did not disappoint. Food was delicious & the waitstaff was nice. We asked to move tables & it was no problem. We even stayed a little past closing & found nothing but the best hospitality. Fantastic experience & we will definitely be coming here again.

The food was amazing and the setting was beautiful. We found the place in yelp and the food didn't disappoint. I would give the place 5 starts but the waiter was rude as my wife and I brought our two young children. They seemed annoyed we were there.  But the food was still good enough to give 5 stars.
I love this place they had the best service and people working here. They were so nice and they did the best birthday celebration for me.

First time here and I had an amazing experience. had the gnocchi and it was absolutely amazing. It was so creamy and dissolved in my mouth. The cocktails were just as great! For dessert I had the crème brûlée and it was very delicate. More than ever though the service was great and the waiter was always checking to make sure everything was okay and that we had everything we needed. 10/10 would definitely come back!

I went here for brunch with a few friends and the food was pretty good. They have a decent selection of items on the menu so your entire party is likely to find something they like. Cocktails are a little pricey but that's NYC brunch for you; they were at least delicious. Absolutely get the pannacotta!

Da Andrea save the Day! We were a party of 7 with no reservation. They did not hesitate to take us last minute. Treated us well. Certain pasta were not on the brunch menu. So they went out of their way to serve us what we wanted. Everyone was so kind
The food was good.  The service was not up to par.  This is an Italian restaurant and they brought the primi and secondi at that same time....

Very pleasantly surprised at how good it was. A very lively crowd. Very attentive waiter (Jim). Food was very good. We had the burrata and Caesar salad, veal ravioli and penne with eggplant. Crème brûlée and apple tart for dessert. Did not feel rushed. Able to enjoy our bottle of wine, though the complimentary 'limoncello' was really grappa. Would def go back. One draw back was bathroom. No where to stand to wait in line for the 2 tiny bathrooms so people were literally standing next to our table while waiting to use the bathroom.
I really like this place. The ambience is really great and romantic. Squid ink pasta is really good!!
No comment
The veal meatballs are to die for and the Buratta was delicious as well. The paparadelle with sausage was awesome along with the ricotta gnocchi and spicy sauce. For NYC, prices were very reasonable.
No comment
It was my first time here and it was delicious! The tiramisu was great and Ceda gave great service

Upon finding a large glass shard tucked into our napkin the waiter replied w/ a simple "oh.. really?". Meal resembled maggots in chef boyardee marinara. All-around absolute mid-tier, canned cuisine. All for about $75 per person. Took the time to download this app and make an account just to post this: 2.5/10
No comment

Came here on my birthday with a couple of friends. I hadn't been previously so wasn't sure what to expect, but it was really busy on a Monday, so I knew right away that we picked a good spot. Pasta was delicious, our server was kind, and they brought out a special birthday dessert + even sang happy birthday. Overall really enjoyed eating here!
No comment
Our dishes were so good and the wine selections paired perfectly. Ambiance was pleasant and inviting. Wait staff were knowledgeable and very accommodating. Would definitely recommend dining here!
No comment

the carpaccio and cavatelli di ricotta was phenomenal, carbonara a bit too heavy for me (quite too cheesy) but still quite good! pappardelle was okay would choose the others and caesar was not flavorful enough, server was phenomenal and paid attention to us. would recommend
Atmosphere inside was nice but crowded, outside was decorated very cute. Service and food was good but menu was limited because they were serving just Sunday brunch. Overall a good experience.
No comment

Very very pretty place to dine if you're sitting outside. Sucks that the sidewalk gets so much traffic and people feel super comfortable basically hovering their butts next our plates while waiting for friends/tables. We got a table for two and felt so crowded. I think this place would be better for a slightly bigger group so you can get seated with mod room from others standing and less body to food interaction with strangers. Service is fast and food is decent, the spinach truffle ravioli needed a bit of salt but after fixing that it tasted divine
No comment
Service is good and attentive. The atmosphere is nice. But, the food is really mediocre.

This hole in the wall Italian place did not disappoint. The atmosphere was inviting and warm.  The wine was good and I will not forget the pasta anytime soon. We wanted great Italian food, and we got it!
Great date night spot. The food was SO good and our waiter was amazing. Highly recommend, and it's not that expensive compared to other restaurants, and again the food was amazing!
No comment

This place is a gem, it's cozy and cute inside. Staff is very friendly and the food is great! The best dish for me was the pork chop, it's unreal so good you must try!! Great selection of wines.Definitely recommend!

A good place for tourist visiting NYC - beside of this avoid. Food is not good - my server didn't want to be here, so I left after ordering. No way this place get this quality of reviews with all the jewels around this area.
No comment

Food was amazing! Had the special squid ink pasta stuffed with salmon, and the Ceasar salad to start. The pasta had so many flavorful notes in every bite. Also had a great espresso martini to end the meal. Would recommend!

I arrived early for my reservation and was seated promptly in their dining shed although my friend had not yet arrived.  The food was excellent.  We shared a special walnut salad.  I had the special butternut squash ravioli, and we shared the dessert.  Service was outstanding.  Our waiter was prompt, attentive and knowledgeable about the menu.
BEST SERVICE I'VE EVER EXPERIENCED. Like it shouldn't have been possible for them to be on top of things as much as they were. Really awesome and food is incredible. 5/5!!

I really want to rave about the Zupa Pesci dish! It was absolutely one of the best I've EVER had! We were looking for a new place to go to when we stumbled on this cozy joint! I would say that I wish the drinks were stronger for the price but regardless everything else, including our excellent server, was A+! :-)
No comment

Great place to dine from a friends referral! The  sweet sausage ragu and veal ravioli tasted very good and seasoned just right! I stopped by with no reservations, but was treated very well and seated very quickly! Will have to return to try more food since this was a unplanned stop!
Great pasta. Do not miss if you're a pasta lover. The salmon is amazing. Perfectly cooked. The only disappointment was the apple dessert was a bit soggy.
Fresh pasta. Good service good ambiance... quick recommendation from the servers... salad to dessert perfect
No comment

We were in from DC for a quick weekend in NYC and this place was recommended to us for brunch. It was perfect. We had the mussels to start- they were hot, cooked to perfection and in a rich tomato broth that I wanted to drink. The two different versions of Eggs benedicts we got were delicious. The warm focaccia bread upon our arrival was so good I almost ruined my meal on it! Prices are very reasonable for Manhattan. The service was wonderful and we were so pleased with everything. Their front outside patio is just gorgeous, but as it was a little chilly we sat inside and literally had the restaurant to ourselves for a (short) while. Go here for a drink and a meal- you won't be sorry!

All of us finished our plates clean! We all ordered a different item and they were all absolutely incredible. Great specials + great service. Sasha was our waiter and he was incredible! So knowledgeable about the menu + wine selection. We really enjoyed our time here!
What a great spot! Food, ambience, service, and everything about this place was amazing. Would definitely return again next time I'm in town!
Service was personal and the food was incredible. Each dish was very fresh and flavorful. The outdoor dining area was wonderful and Covid safe. Will be back for sure

Loved the resto, the flower and light designt, vibe was very delightful. We got carbonara and steak. Carbonara was tasty but was very disappointed with my steak, asked for tenderloin medium done but received a rare done tenderloin -see the pic posted.

Da Andrea was such a great restaurant! We ordered so much food, drinks, and everything was so incredible. Marco, our server, was the best! He was so friendly and prompt and had a smile that will steal your heart! Definitely recommend.

This place is AMAZING! I was lucky and got a reservation on the same day on a Friday. The pasta and the service was outstanding! Big thanks to our server Marco who was delightful and handled our big loud group perfectly. The gnocchi and pappardelle were delicious. We can't wait to come back!

Went here for my friend's birthday. This place is exceptional. The servers are very kind and extremely attentive. The atmosphere is gorgeous with some nice music during the brunch. And the food is sublime. So highly recommend! Again - the staff is amazing!!! well done!
Excellent ravioli!! Drinks were strong and a reservation is definitely needed. Beautiful outdoor setup.

Sasha from da Andrea was the most knowledgeable and best waiter I have ever had in my life. I would come back solely for the pleasure of dining with him and learning more about his knowledge and passion for food. Food and ambiance was amazing and da Andrea is a must try!!!!
This place was nicely decorated with floral on the outside. The food was delicious and the staff was great, they are friendly and very welcoming.

Stopped by here because of how cute the front/outdoor seating was. My friend and I were just looking for an afternoon wine in between activities so we sat on their patio and enjoyed a bottle of Prosecco and their bread and olive oil. The food smelled amazing though so I would totally go back and eat here!
This place is amazing! Ambiance, food, and our server Jim was incredible! We started with the beet salad and burrata - then I had the papardelle which was stellar. Definitely recommend this place!!

Da Andrea was fantastic start to finish! It is cozy and warm inside, and the food is phenomenal. We had the warm octopus salad to start, we split an order of the homemade spinach ravioli filled with truffle and ricotta, and we each got a pasta dish...all of which was house-made.Panna cotta rounded out a fantastic meal, and our wonderful server Sasha gave us complimentary limoncello for my birthday. I would go back to this place in a heartbeat and highly recommend it!
Great restaurant! the place was so relaxing, good staff
Food was good but my waiter was a bit rude..other than that I'd come back here
No comment
Food was wonderful delicious, and gorgeous! Loved the ambiance inside and outside. The flowers were a nice touch too. The servers were hospitable!

Nothing really impressed me, the restaurant is cute and it has a nice outdoor seating, the food was ok and the service as well. There are so many good restaurants in the area so I won't probably go back.

I wish I could give more than 5 stars. While running errands my friend and I stopped here for lunch and how fortunate we were that we did. The food was fantastic. We had the ravioli and the salmon, which I highly recommend ordering. Their cocktails were perfection and the staff was outstanding. Carlos, our waiter, went above and beyond to make our quick lunch an unforgettable experience.
Food is pretty good, some italian classics and some twists, and for their prices it's 100% worth it. Highly recommended.

I needed to get my pasta fix in nyc and Yelp led me to Da Andrea. The pasta here is amazing. I got the Mediterranean which is a vegetarian pasta in a red sauce. My friend got the pappardelle with truffle oil which was even better. The focaccia they served had great texture and even though it wasn't warm it was delicious dipped into olive oil. Our server was friendly and attentive. He checked in on us every so often and never made us feel rushed. We spent a few hours in the beautifully decorated (and heated!) parklet. Highly recommend!

This restaurant was absolutely amazing. Our server Mirjana couldn't have been better. Everything was super quick, her recommendations were completely amazing and her smile is infectious. All the food came out timely and perfect. I had the best piece of salmon I've ever had and my pasta was was out of this world. I dine out just about every meal and Mirjana was handedly the best server I've seen by a mile. You must come here and experience the ambiance, great service, and amazing food quality. Will be returning without a question for Mirjana alone. I would give 10 stars if I could.

A very delicious meal was had at Da Andrea. Foccocia bread for the table was delicious as were the drinks. Ambiance outside is stunning. I ate the cavatelli pesto, which was delicious. Not the best pesto I have ever had. I wish it had more flavor to it, but the pasta was delicious. Both of the people who I went with loved their entrees. Price is great for the quality of food as well.

Me and friends visiting from out of town came here for dinner and had the best time. Service was amazing Jim was super helpful and attentive. The pasta here is amazing. Highly recommend the gnocchi and parpadelle. Great ambiance and great food will definitely be back.
Very pretty place with excellent service. The food, however, is pretty mediocre. Not bad at all, mind you, just doesn't stand out.

The food was incredible! I had ravioli di noci and the sauce was amazing. The walnuts were a great addition. Marco was our server and he did amazing! He had amazing recommendations. Highly recommend this restaurant. Cute environment!

Food was ok, service was terrible. The waiter was rude and didn't help us during that whole evening. It was unfortunate since it was the first time coming and we hoped it would be great! Turned out to be overpriced hype.

We expected to be a great experience after reading all those reviews. But turn into a huge disappointment...so They got us seated in the corner end. There were still empty tables around us. Yet we felt neglected. The servers were rushing back and forth while we waved for a long time to place an order. The appetizer took 10 mins to serve, and we waited for another 30 mins for the main course.  Food was not that spectacular. We gave up on getting the dessert in the end, as they once again neglected us while we waved for a long time. Our time was precious too. The restaurant should hired extra staffs stand in between stations just to be sure customers won't have what we experienced.
One of my favorite Italian restaurants in the city! Sasha was amazing!! Everything is so authentic and flavorful and the restaurant is beautiful!
No comment
No comment

From start to finish, we had a great experience. The food was served relatively quickly despite how busy the restaurant was (we arrived early on a Sunday night with reservations). The food was delicious and fresh. We ordered the tuna tartare and beef carpaccio as appetizers, then the filet mignon manzo and salmon dishes. However, I do feel that the serving size for the main entrees was a bit small for the price. I also highly appreciated the server who noticed it was my partner's birthday since he was opening his gifts at the table after we had our dinner, and threw in a small dessert for us at the end of the meal with a lit birthday candle! It was such a kind gesture and we were very touched. I would definitely go back again. :)
No comment
Excellent food and great service by James. Wonderful ambiance. Ordered the squid ink pasta and crème brûlée which were both lovely.
Walked in without a reservation on a Sunday night. Still very busy though. Everything tasted great! Only reason I'm giving 4/5 is because it didn't totally blow me away.
Amazing meatballs and spaghetti bolognese was great too. beautiful ambiance and service was top tier. Carlos was our server, he's attentive and kind.
Great food! The service, ambiance and live music make it a perfect post for a weekend brunch.
Everything was great! Sasha was wonderful. Would absolutely come back for the bolognese
Amazing service from Marco. Delicious food, Had the gnocchi! Wonderful ambience!! Perfect for your next date night.
Excellent food and service. We had dinner here the day after our return from Italy, and the food did not disappoint! The filet mignon was one of the best in memory! I highly recommend!
Gorgeous ambiance, cozy Italian spot, amazing food, great service. Absolutely going back!
No comment

D'Andrea's is amazing! For starters, we enjoyed a flavorful pear, arugula & gorgonzola. We had a delicious Spaghetti Carbobara featuring freshly-made Chitarra pasta, and a luscious ricotta & mushroom filled spinach ravioli. Christian, our waiter, was super attentive and friendly. His  knowledge & pronunciation of the dishes was impeccable! We will definitely be comlng back here very soon. Bravo, and thanks again, Christian!
Great vibes. Reccomend this spot. Italian was pretty good. Shout out to my guy Carlos. Great service

The food was super tasty and well priced tbh for the quality of the food and the classiness of the restaurant. My first time here, the service was amazing! The second time unfortunately we were asked to wait 15-20 minutes outside even though we reserved in advance but otherwise the waiter was friendly and helpful.

Service was ok. Manager was nice but condescending. Food was completely over cooked. Inside is meh. Nothing special. Outside is decorated nicely with flowers but deceiving from its pictures online. There's not much ambience inside... go for drinks and maybe brunch but I do not recommend dinner or their pasta. The pizza was good but a little undercooked.. I won't be back!
Awesome food and service. Live music was a big plus as well. Definitely coming back another time. Highly recommended for weekend brunch! :)
Service is 10/10. Prices are very reasonable for the location, decor, and quality of food. Much of the pasta is made on premises.

Absolutely love the food at da Andrea-- super fresh homemade pasta, delicious desserts, and wonderful service! Our waitress, Seda, is so sweet and has great recommendations! So excited to come back to Da Andrea
great food and the service was excellent, knowledgeable waiter , attendant bus perspn and awsome bartender

The ambiance outside is quite nice but this place does great crowded. If you're looking to have a conversation with your meal this place may not be it for you as it does get loud. The food was good but the cocktails weren't very strong.  Servers very attentive!
Great Brunch with friends- Super nice place with great service - they didn't rush us out.... and food all around was great.  We ate inside - but outside space is attractive and seemed warm.
No comment
Great place, good vibes and nice outside decor. Manager went out of his way to make sure we have a good time, really nice food and decently priced I highly recommend

Came here for my birthday with my friends, and I was not disappointed. Everything was so delicious, from appetizers to entrees. Our waiter was extremely helpful, and super nice. It was the best place to be for my birthday. Definitely can't wait to come back during summer! Especially given how beautiful the outside is decorated!

We had a great evening here! For appetizers, I reccomend the beef carpaccio. It was very fresh and the dressing was delicious. I had the spaghetti carbonara as a main and the handmade pasta is a must try. Ambiance inside is warm and cozy, but looking forward to sitting outside next time when the weather is warm!

Service was slow and the poached egg was not ooey-gooey enough. In fact, it was hard-boiled! Aside from these inconveniences (which left something to be desired) the rosemary focaccia & truffle fettuccine were dishes to die for. Recommended for a lazy Sunday, as you may have to wait...
No comment

Came here with friends after Pride- made a reservation & was seated within 5min. Here's where they had us twisted.. it took about 10-15min for someone to bring us water. No bread was given to us & we never had the pleasure of meeting our server. After waiting without service for 45min, we decided to leave. It would've been nice to at least have someone check on us. The staff was rude. The host though, was pretty nice.
Great service and excellent food. Ordered a type of mushroom pasta that was excellent.

Took my team out for dinner and WOW - delicious food, beautiful atmosphere and great service!  Staff was friendly and welcoming and very accommodating!  Everyone was so pleased with their meals and the portions were perfect!  Great drinks too!

This place was such a great surprise. The food was really really good and the seafood was fresh. It did get pretty packed so I recommend a reservation. About the reservation...if you don't confirm right as they call you, they cancel your reservation so make sure you call them right back if you're not able to get to it. More a suggestion for the restaurant but I think investing in a text confirmation system would probably benefit you. Your patrons are usually in the middle of a busy work day when confirmation calls come in and it's difficult to respond back with another phone call within the window I had.

Service is very bad. My waiter is so rude. Can't believe he rolled his eyes when I asked him about his recommendation for the food especially when I was asking for pizza. Even though I had made reservation, we were still told to wait for 30minutes. Supposed to be a date night with bf to celebrate anniversary but the atmosphere was ruined. Will never come back anymore. Had to wait so long for pasta and filet mignonette. Even though Crème brûlée was given for free was too sweet. Will never come back again
Great pasta. A little bit a long wait but we made a reservation and we got seated 10 minutes later. Carlos was a great waiter and the service was great.
No comment

One of the best Italian restaurants we have ever been too! Service was excellent and the food was absolutely delicious! This along with a great atmosphere makes this place one we welcome to return to and also recommend to all of our many friends when visiting NYC!

Da Andrea is a solid Italian spot, and they've got a good outdoor dining setup. My boyfriend and I easily made a reservation. We shared the pappardelle with sweet sausage ragout, Tigelle modenesi con prosciutto (that was the highlight) and a grilled pork chop. I was too full for tiramisu but would try that next time!
Literally amazing!! The food is so good and amazingly priced!! Food and espresso martinis were to die for!

The decor was amazing. The service was accommodating. We had outdoor seating, but it was quite hot outside, so we asked to be seated inside, without hesitation or wait time, they moved us inside. The food was amazing! I got the lamb... delicious!
No comment

We have been in New York for seven days and been in NYC many times and can honestly say this is one of the best meals we have had here! The pasta was fresh and the service was terrific... Hats off to Sasha our server, friendly, knowledgeable, attentive! We recommend this restaurant for anyone who loves fresh tasty Italian food. We will be back on our next visit.
Great food and service! Seda, our server, was so knowledgable and provided great suggestions.
Stumbled upon this Amazing gem with my boyfriend. Food is amazing! Servers are nice! Small and cute little Italian restaurant
No comment
The best spot for an intimate dinner or a small group! Great food and Claudia and Nicholas are wonderful servers

Actually one of the best Italian places you'll be able to find around the city, great location, great food and amazing service and overall vibe. Def check it out if you haven't been before (and get the pesto salmon dish!!)

The food here was very aesthetic and tasty. We found this gem while we were walking around the area. I ordered the bolognese and it was so yum! We had a vegetable sizzling appetizer as well with was incredible. Would definitely recommend.
It was a pleasant surprise to come here for my NYE dinner! Great food, wonderful and easy going service. And all the waiters wear masks is a huge plus! Would definitely come back again! Thank you!

Mediocre food and poor service. The food was shockingly bad. The waiter dropped pepper in my tea and was nonchalant about it. Not sure how this has 4.5 stars. This is a tourist spot that likely games their yelp scores

I came to this restaurant from out of town based on a recommendation. It absolutely did not disappoint. The service was top notch and the food was delicious. I would definitely recommend one of their cocktails! The atmosphere was super cozy and a great place to go with friends.

The place was packed on a Saturday night. We  had a large party and waited about 20 minutes for a table even with reservations. Service and was good overall. Food was average. Most of the pasta dishes were overcooked and clumped together on the dish. Squid Ink Tagliatelle was bland and pasta was mushy in texture. The mussels appetizers and the Zuppa De Pesce are basically the same dishes.  Both  are served with toast in exactly the same broth. The only difference is Zuppa De Pesce has shrimp, calamari and fish added. But no real difference in flavor. Apple tart and panna cotta  were the standouts in the desserts.
Outside set up is beautiful. Inside is just okay. If possible, eat outside. The food was solid. I ordered the salmon and it was cooked well - moist and flavorful.
This place was super nice! Our sever Marco was super attentive and very helpful. The food was good and you get a free drink if you write a review. The desserts were amazing. I would come back again!

If you're looking for a cute date spot, with a warm setup for seating, well decorated, and with good wine, this is a good find. That said, compared to other Italian places in NY, the food is subpar. We ordered Spaghetti Bolognese and the Spicy Tomato Penne. Pasta was al dente but the flavors of the dishes weren't well balanced. I'd come back for the wine and the vibe but perhaps not for the food
Super cozy and cute! Sasha our server was very warm and kind :) We got two pastas to share and they split it into two which was super thoughtful

After a trip to the union square market, my boyfriend and I were looking for a place to eat. We found Da Andrea on Yelp and booked a reservation right away. The restaurant was packed with we got there and so there was still a bit of a wait but I didn't mind, it was packed on a Monday night and that was all I needed to know (in a good way). Service was top notch, incredibly attentive, thoughtful answers to our questions, and great suggestions. The food was SO GOOD. We ordered the octopus appetizer which was divine. After some Yelp research, I decided to get the pappardelle pasta. It's a must. My boyfriend got the Salmon entree, he took one bite and said "babe, omg you have to try this!" And then finished his plate quicker than I could finish my pasta. Sincere compliments to the chefs at this place! Cocktail menu is also pretty decent. I'm used to Italian restaurants not having interesting options so it was a nice surprise. We ordered coffee and desert and they gave us limoncello on the house! It was a bit of a bummer that the tables are so close to each other. I'd definitely come again but plan to come outside peak dinner time.
Sasha took amazing care of us while we were visiting the city for my birthday! The food was great, and he gave us great recommendations and made the experience wonderful! Highly recommend!
Da Andrea did not disappoint! Everything we had was amazing. Highly recommend. Waiter was perfect!

Last minute lunch with the wife. Outside you will probably need a reservation due to the lovely flowers around their outside table street structure and nice food. Solid Italian fare. We sat inside and had salads and flatbread. The flatbread that tasted like traditional northern Italian pizza. Would recommend for sure. Nice place, friendly staff.
No comment

Ambient cozy place with very friendly and attentive stuff. Interior looks great. Food here was great too. Carbonara and gnocchi has Italian  flavor. Definitely place to visit if you are looking for Italian dishes but be prepared that place can be packed.
No comment
No comment

Came for brunch. Pretty middle of the road. Good vibe, nice servers, but food was pretty lack luster. I have a suspicion the dinner might be better. Wouldn't say avoid, especially because the brunch atmosphere was nice and it was easy to get a reservation the day of, but I wouldn't go out of my way to go there.

Da Andrea is literally a few steps away from my apartment so when I first moved in I was hoping it would be my regular "go-to" restaurant. Then COVID. But I don't think anything could diminish the experience of dining here -- or taking their cooking home. I love what they've done to the street with their outdoor space.  And they are super careful about checking vaccination proof, which makes me feel good about eating inside as well. Oh, and the food: I have never been disappointed! Between family and friends' visits (or takeout) we must have gone through the entire menu a few times by now. All I can say is that after each meal I say to myself "that's my favorite"!  The service is warm and gracious, they happily substitute pastas if you're craving a different combination, their wine list is solid and unpretentious.  I'm very grateful for my neighborhood restaurant!

Good food and beautiful outdoor sitting area but service can be better.  Waited forever in between dinner, dessert, and the bill.  The wait was painful.  If you don't mind taking time to eat and talk... it's a great place.  Give it a try.

This is my first time at Da Andrea. It was a lovely ambiance and the pasta was amazing to say the least. Homemade pasta I had was delicioso. The desert was perfectly executed. Definitely would come back when visiting again!

This place offers indoor and outdoor dining.  We dined outside under the colorful pink trellis.  The food was excellent, presentation was beautiful, service was great.  We had the burrata and roasted vegetables starters.  For entrees we had the Salmon, Pappardelle, Cavatelli, and fish special and everyone loved their dish. Our server even offered a great place to try for after dinner drinks.

It was our first time here and the food was exceptional! Marco was our server and he was super friendly and helpful. He was attentive and kind. The pastas and desserts were all very delicious. We will definitely come back!

Went here on a date with my girlfriend. The pasta dishes here were excellent and the lovely conversation we had with our waiter Sasha made us feel very very welcomed. Some of the best hospitality and service I've experienced since on my trip to New York
Great place for a casual meal. Patio is indeed beautiful, but the inside isn't much to rave out. The ravioli is a must have, absolutely delicious.
No comment
We were the party of 5 visiting here for the first time and absolutely enjoyed the experience. The service was amazing and the food was great! Worth the wait - must try!

column6: No comment
Great food and service. The mushroom ravioli was amazing, and Melanie was so sweet!!!
Melanie was our waitress tonight and she was fantastic! Great service and great food overall.
This was so good!! All the waiters were very kind and helpful and the food was delicious!! Would definitely recommend. Don't forget to order dessert!
No comment
Very average Italian restaurant.. the food was ok but nothing memorable. The service was also extremely slow. I wouldn't go back.
Cute, well decorated restaurant. Unfortunately the space outdoors and indoors were way too tight, and the food was just okay. I would pay the same elsewhere.

Let me tell y'all, my man's Sasha, was an amazing server. I had a great dinner at the restaurant, which the food was great to begin with but the server made it even better. I had an easy time ordering and the food came out in a timely manner. Would come back, and the pastas in the middle of the menu were all good (my table had a mix of them).
While the servers were very pleasant, the dried-out grilled shrimp over the soggy bread and flavorless sauce was not.
I had the best time, James definitely made us feel comfortable and guided us to this amazing dinner
Good Italian, not amazing but not bad.  Mussels were actually my favorite dish.  Gnocchi was a little heavy.  Very crowded, but again, not in a bad way.
Everything was delicious and authentic! A must stop.  Sasha was an incredible server, very kind and knowledgeable.
No comment

Very cute atmosphere with the food was just OK. Not bad, but not amazing. The patio is absolutely gorgeous, and I would come back just to sit at the patio and have drinks and maybe appetizers. Very romantic.

A couple friends and I liked Da Andrea. Their ambience was good, and the food was OK+. 3.5/5 stars, rounded up to 4. I probably won't try to go back often, but you can definitely do worse when it comes to Italian food.
This is one of my favorite restaurants in New York City. Great food, wonderful unobtrusive service, and a warm, homey atmosphere. If you like Italian food, you will love Da Andrea.
Amazing food and amazing service! Our waiter Christian picked all of our entrees and it was all delicious. Beautiful atmosphere as well. Perfect place for a date or girls night
Food and service was amazing . Would highly recommend the octopus salad and pappardelle!
Came here for brunch, the food was excellent, and there's a great ambience. Had amazing service from Sidy and Nicholas. 100% recommend.
Was a really lovely meal! The pasta was incredible and super fresh. Service was okay, but enjoyed my dinner.
Meh! Nothing to write home about. Pleasant outdoor dining area but a little busy if you're not used to NY traffic. Not for a nice quiet dinner.

Da Andrea is such an amazing restaurant!! The pasta is amazing and made daily!! I've been here two times and each time it has been better then I expected!! I've tried multiple things on the menu and they have all been delicious!! The desserts are amazing as well! The staff is all friendly and helpful. Our waiter was Marco and he was amazing!!! Will b coming back soon!!!

I was there for lunch (brunch is available on Saturday and Sunday) and ordered the pappardelle with sausage dish.  The pasta was made al dente and the sauce was delicious.  Outdoor seating is available with ceiling heaters.  I plan to dine there whenever I'm in the neighborhood.
Great food and great service and atmosphere. A really enjoyable night. Thanks again. The cocktails were great. Loved the veal meatballs and salmon and prawn pesto dish.

Horrible tourist trap. We had reservations and still waited in a 30 person line! Although their service staff is attentive and nice, the food just doesn't match. The place is just is not worth the hype. Lamb was badly over cooked and had a weird sweet spice and sauce on it that did not belong. Pasta was under seasoned and the sauce was very plain/nothing special. To top it off, the outdoor space has some bugs - was bitten by mosquitoes pretty badly while sitting outside.
No comment
Good service , pretty interior and very delicious Cavatelli with pesto , shrimp & salmon
Super cute outside set up. Food was really good and the service was good as well! Will definitely go back!
amazing food !! the service amazing, and the quality impecable. highly recommend if you like italian food.

Such a great experience and yummy food!! Sasa was our waiter and he was so friendly and super knowledgeable about the menu! He suggested the black truffle ravioli and it was fantastic! He gave us such great service which made our experience at Da Andrea so amazing!!
Loved dining here! Our servers were very friendly and knowledgeable about the menu. Pappardelle was delicious! will definitely come back :)
Great service! The food was delish and my drink was great but the service was top notch - definitely felt looked after  would recommend and will be back!
The food and the drinks were amazing, but the manager service was spectacular! Thank you for making our experience better!

Wonderful ambiance, tasty and great menu with something on it for everyone. They don't allow for substitutions, however. Also, we asked the hostess for outdoor seating. We initially were told that there would be a wait for a table and that the service would be "slow" outside because they were short staffed. That didn't really make sense to us, though, since most people wanted to be outside, too. (It was a gorgeous day for a Sunday brunch.) We said that we'd wait and wound up being seated outside a few minutes after. Service wasn't slow, either, which makes me think they just were trying to save outdoor tables on a beautiful day...
No comment
Wonderful Italian food.  Staff is very attentive!  Delicious pastas, specials and service!  One of our favorites!!!
The pork chop was amazing! Very tender and grilled to perfection ! Highly Recommended!

The decor is very pretty, but the food isn't outstanding at all for the price. We ordered their veal with truffle (one of the specials), the raviolis band the risotto. All average I would say and the table was very small. But their tiramisu was quite good!

column3: Old Bridge, Old Bridge Township, NJ
column6: Started off with the muscles and they were to die for. I was literally drinking the sauce. For dinner, I ordered the lobster asparagus poached egg and it was delicious!!! Vibes were everything.
I had an awesome birthday dinner here. Their heated outdoor seating was very comfortable, and our server Nicholas was so friendly and helpful. The food came quickly too and was all delicious!
Everything was amazing, from the people to the food. So happy we chose this restaurant for dinner. Would definitely come back if I'm in the area again.

They were overbooked, might have been a good experience if it wasn't 9:00 pm reservation and then an additional wait gor 20-30 minutes, could have been longer looking at the others waiting before us !!! Very disappointed, it was a real waste to a trip to the city :(
Da Andrea is beautiful and the food was amazing. Sasha, our waiter, was just the best, and we had a great time dining here. Would absolutely recommend!!

I was looking for authentic Italian food because sometimes in New York you can get some very inauthentic Italian food. This restaurant was high quality, had variety, and tasted authentic. The menu ranges from classic pasta dishes to unusual and unexpected items. The ambiance was also very soothing in a great part of the city.
Great ambience, gorgeous outdoor seating. All staff were very knowledgeable and polite.
Casually walked into this cute little restaurant and decided to give it a try. No wait for a walk in party of 4... always amazing! Must try for anyone interested!
The food was amazing, great seafood. Cavatelli pasta was good, however the salmon was over cooked in it.

Beautiful restaurant with friendly staff! The outdoor area has floral decor everywhere and it's perfect for a cute date. The cavatelli and papardelle were delicious and flavorful, and not overly rich or salty. The handmade noodles were a plus
Food was great and the portions were the perfect size. The desserts were delicious and you can't beat the ambiance!
No comment

This review is for POC bc this restaurant is racist (they'll probably be happy to have only white people at their establishment). So when everyone in the party (we had a reservation), this Indian host ignores me(despite eye contact), goes past to 3 white people who did not have a reservation to ask where they wanted to sit. They said inside because it was cold and I had to chase him down even though he saw me and he forced us to sit outside and did not give us an option. They then refused to turn our overhead heater on even though we were by the sliding door. We looked up and every single other tables heaters (white ppl) were on. When one friend ordered dessert, two others ordered second drinks. The dessert came and was eaten and we were waiting, the waiter came by and we asked to cancel the drinks. He said ok. He then proceeded to bring the drinks(by that time unappetizing) close to 35 minutes later and charged us. One friend used her credit card and he ignored the rest of us (she paid the whole bill) which is just a weird move for a waiter but unsurprising given this establishment. I already know someone's going to say oh well the ppl who own/work there are brown. That doesn't mean they don't have internalized racism and are also anti Black.

We have been eating at Da Andrea for years.  Why?  Because of all the reasons why you go out to eat, and more:  1.  The food is fantastic, always, consistently good, year over year.  2.  The service is friendly, warm, and memorable.  3.  Everyone goes out of their way to make sure you have a memorable experience, even if you're there for the first time or, like ourselves, been coming for years.  The picture here was from our anniversary.  What a wonderful night.  Hats off to the owners and especially our waiter, Jim, in the picture who went out of the way to make our night special!
This place is delightful! It's a warm, cozy, and classy atmosphere with delicious food and great service. It's also reasonably priced. I'll be a regular.
Absolutely marvelous, outdoor dining is beautiful, make sure to take pictures by the flowers!
Love this restaurant! Marco is really funny and the best server our table met. The pastas are great and their tiramisu is a must try! Bravo!
This restaurant is a hidden gem. The pasta is fresh and delicious. The ambiance is incredible - especially for a date night. We had James serving us and he was so kind. HIGHLY RECOMMEND
such a fan of this place! Great authentic food with great service. Dim lighting, beautiful and very romantic.Thank you James for taking care of us, we'll be back soon!

Very friendly waiters! The food is incredible. I got the puréed asparagus soup which was so smooth and flavorful! Perfect for a spring evening. Also got the cavateli with shrimp and salmon and pesto. Very creamy and delicious!! The salmon melted in my mouth! Highly recommend for anyone looking for a beautiful night out while being very COVID-safe with plenty of space!

Another normal place with warm atmosphere that you can have friendly but not really close conversations (the noise can easily fill any blanks in conversations). Food is so-so and seems done in a rush. Given the restaurant's popularity, it's understandable.
No comment

Da Andrea is the perfect place for solid Italian food--and especially so, in a pandemic. They're my go-to for whenever people from out of town visit the City; well located and somehow always with outdoor availability, even upon short notice, the combination of the food quality, ambiance, and great service, to boot, makes Da Andrea a favourite of mine.

Beautiful flowery ambiance, friendly and attentive staff, and scrumptious food. The waiters were very knowledgeable of all menu items which helped my group find pasta, beef, and wine that we would love. I'll be back!

Highly recommend Da Andrea.  Excellent food and truly great service.  Our waiter was very responsive and attentive.  Genuinely nice people all around.  The outside dining is very idyllic.  Pastas are home made and very delicate, totally fresh and very tasty. Dog friendly is another plus.
Our server Sasha was amazing!! Top notch service and food - will be back for this man
We just had Christmas meal here, and it was amazingggg. I am def coming back here in near future. Their pasta is bomb!

Da Andrea went above and beyond our expectations! I highly recommend eating here. We had a reservation at 7 and they were nice enough to seat us when we came early at 5:30. The servers were very attentive to us as well. My boyfriend got the Filetto Di Manzo and he was obsessed with it, the filet was so tender. I had the Gnocchi with gorgonzola sauce and I was VERY happy as well. I assumed it was house made gnocchi. Everything was very well balanced and authentic. Drinks were delicious too! They were kind enough to bring us each a white wine on the house with our dessert. Thank you Da Andrea!
The place is amazing. Loved the service by Sasha!!! He was super sweet. I would totally recommend visiting the place and having a fun chat with Sasha.
Have gone here many more times since my initial review and it's always delicious and my go to for Italian in the city. Love it!
No comment

The food, the vibe, everything was pretty much 10/10. All 5 of us had different pastas and they were all solid and plates were cleaned real quick. Sasha as your waiter is the only way to go. Really good experience.
No comment

Cavatelli with shrimp, salmon, pesto was phenomenal and, paired with the decorations (lights,flowers,etc), the experience was a great night. Christian was a very attentive server and the menu offered a variety of options. Wine  food  service  location

I came here for my 25th birthday and it was absolutely perfect. The waiter recommended a list flavorful Tuscany wine, and sang me happy birthday. I wouldn't recommend any other Italian restaurant in NYC!
Our server Marco made our night! The food/ wine were delicious. We recommend getting the appetizer with prosciutto it was unlike anything we have ever had.

column3: South Los Angeles, Los Angeles, CA
column6: Amazing service from Christian. Gave us great wine recommendations. Beautiful scenery. Lovely night of meeting up with old friends in a beautiful environment

A good and cute restaurant but a terrible manager. He decided to call a staff meeting in the middle of the work day for 15 mins. Completely disturbed entire restaurant's workflow, and I genuinely felt bad for the waiters who had to deal with a lot of frustrated customers after the staff meeting was over. The manager didn't seem to care and was drunk with "power."

Very disappointing. Our reserved table for brunch was not ready, so we eventually had to pick out our own and sit down. The avocado toast barely had any avocado on it ($18). The margarita flatbread barely had any tomato sauce ($19). The seasonal fruit salad: one strawberry, one raspberry, half of a sliced pear... ($16). No...just no.
No comment
No comment
Had a wonderful dinner with Sasha as our waiter. He is so knowledgable and made our time really an experience. :) thank you for a great night!

Absolutely loved our waiter Nicolas. He took such good care of us and was such an amazing presence. Great espresso martini and limoncello for dessert :) let us bring our own cake for someone's birthday and gave us amazing Recs on tigelle for apps. Definitely eat outside with heaters. Perfect!

Not great. I've been here twice now and it's just not worth it. The pasta is pretty bland. Nothing stands out. There are definitely better Italian restaurants on the west side. Also the dessert was not tasty. The chocolate cake didn't even have any chocolate flavor. Will not be returning again.

Weezy out here....  Reservation on a Tuesday for 7 and we had to wait for over 30 minutes. The restaurant takes reservations on yelp and opentable and they clearly don't know how to manage their seating. If you guarantee a table then the table should be guaranteed. Period.
Got the pappardelle, cavatelli, and taglioni. Sauce was really good. The cavatelli was the best one. We licked the plates clean. Large restaurant and good vibes
No comment

Everything here was very solid, from the cocktails to the service to the food. We started with the tigelle and prosciutto. The bread was piping hot. A big hit with the kids, too. We ordered three pastas (tagliolini, the bolonese and the carbonara for the kids). The carbonara was excellent, perhaps the best I've had. The other two were delicious. We will absolutely come back to try some of the secondi.

Was excited to go here after seeing great reviews, but I don't understand the hype at all. The food and service was mediocre at best, seating was cramped (we were seated outside--note to those booking on Yelp, those are only for outdoor tables). We ordered a few dishes for our vegetarian family of 4, and while there were options, it felt limited. Overall it was a very basic neighborhood restaurant and I am think I am being generous with the 3 stars.
Wonderful service. Isaac was very helpful. He helped us decide on our meal and was very accommodating. Would definitely come back

Everything was great. Atmosphere, food, service. Good place for date. The big tunnel of fuscia flowers covering the outside area kind of makes it feel like Valentine's Day, so it may feel like kind of a "cute" date, especially if you sit outside. Depends if you want that or not! Either way fellas, it will look like you tried. It's classy and modern without being overly formal or expensive.

Food was very fresh and good, and it was exactly what the price was worth. However, the service wasn't that great. Our server barely accommodated to our needs, and complained about not tipping him enough. He returned with our check and demanded more, and passive aggressively asked what was wrong. The food is worth a try, but hopefully the time you go, you'll meet a good server.

A lovely place with floral decor outside--- very hard to miss! The staff was very prompt and their tartufo mushroom pasta is something for the history books! Perfect place for a nice brunch and I highly recommend!
Just remembering my time at this place makes me hungry! I ate out here during my trip to New York, they did not disappoint! I look forward to coming back during my next visit.
Great food. Friendly and quick service. Very charming indoor and outdoor setup. Vegetarian friendly options. Definitely repeating.
Amazing spot, down to earth and a great service by Sasha. He had such a colorful history with food and his presence was the perfect compliment to the amazing food.
I loved it from start to finish, the service was incredible, and the food was amazing.

All pasta was DELICIOUS! They brought us lots of bread and olive oil (the focaccia was DIVINE!). The Pappardelle was our favorite out of all. Marco was are server and an absolute gem. He was funny and so kind! All servers were warm and fantastic. The atmosphere was beautiful, we loved sitting outside under the lights and flowers. We will be back many times and bring our friends here!

From the gorgeous floral atmosphere to the authentic homemade pasta, Da Andrea never disappoints. We came here for breakfast and returned for dinner the same day, it was that good. Marco was our server- friendly and helpful. He is a true Italian. The papardelle was delightful and the truffle oil flavor really shined. The gnocchi was perfectly creamy and the Mediterranean pasta was a fresh dish on the lighter side. Best of all was the unlimited focaccia!! Tiramisu topped off the dinner! Cant wait to do it again tomorrow
all dishes tonight are amazing, the cappellacci is mind-blowing(literally) and the fish specials is also greay

Delicious pasta!! The sauce taste amazing  Marco is the best server. Recommend this place.

I made a reservation for 5 at 8pm and the place was very full. We got seated around 8:20pm. The food ended up being fantastic and the dessert was even better. My server was named Carlos and he was very attentive. I would recommend coming here, but be ready for a bit of wait.

INCREDIBLE outdoor dining set up. They have this built structure with sliding doors and heat lamps that feels both safe and comfortable. We went for drinks, but ended up having the octopus salad which was really good. I plan to come back for dinner sometime
Had the best time here, if you get Sasha best waiter ever!!! The food is amazing have to get the truffle ravioli.
This place was amazing, flat bread was the best I've ever had. The Pinot was excellent, I will definitely be coming back here
No comment

This restaurants ambiance, food, and service is amazing. Each dish was cooked to perfection. Our server gave us great wine recommendations and was helpful in deciding what dishes to get. Would definitely come back here again and highly recommend this place!!

Delicious Italian food! Great service, especially from our waiter Carlos! I ordered the veal ravioli which was so good. The staff really takes care of their customers.
