We had brunch here and it was amazing! Our server, Sasha, was attentive and awesome! Will definitely be coming back. 10/10 recommend!

My husband and I had late night dinner here and overall the experience was just wonderful. From the appetizers to the entrees to the dessert and the excellent service -- we were already planning a return to the restaurant even before leaving. Highly recommended.

We decided to go to this restaurant on a whim because of the beautiful facade, and we were not disappointed. Even though it was packed the service was excellent!! We ordered multiple dishes, which were delicious, especially the truffle risotto special. Our server James was so forthcoming and made this evening memorable.

Nice decorations but food wasn't great and the place is very understaffed. Our service was hurried and inattentive, not, I think, because of anything our server did wrong, but just be because they're stretched so thin. On top of that, the pasta was overcooked and relatively flavorless. If you're looking for an Instagrammable location, this place is fine, but if you're looking for great Italian food, this isn't it.

Da Andrea has a beautiful view and a wonderful ambience that was perfect for my night out. I had a cute window seat that allowed me and my girlfriends to have a really nice dinner. The food was served quickly and our waiter was so nice and attentive! We got our food relatively fast and it was delicious! My girlfriends had the ravioli and the gnocchi and it was so good. The tiramisu was delicious and the Fettucini was amazing! Definitely recommend to anyone looking for the perfect spot to grab lunch or dinner
No comment

My boyfriend and I came here on our last night in town and the whole experience was amazing! The pasta was fresh and flavorful, the salmon was cooked perfectly, and our server Sasa was the best! Would absolutely recommend and we can't wait to visit NYC again soon so we can dine there again. Thank you, Sasa, for such wonderful hospitality!!

Marco was our server tonight and he was fantastic! The food was delicious, our service was super attentive with great recommendations, and they were even able to accommodate a party of 7 last minute. Highly recommend!

Had dinner outside tonight! The appetizers were delicious and fresh. Everything came out quickly. Our waitress Seda was super helpful and attentive! Desserts were also so worth it. Loved the mushroom ravioli!
Had such an amazing time here. Great food but even better service. 10/10 would come again - thank you Marco!
I went to this place for the first time and it was lovely! The vibes are nice and the food is amazing! The staff was also so very friendly as well. Def would recommend!
Food was good but the portion sizes were wayy too small for the price you pay for. Ordered the Parpadelle which was like $25 and it looked like an appetizer rather than a pasta entree.
Great food, atmosphere and experience! Our waiter Sasha was the absolute best. Took very good care of us all night!
Great place. Good service. Delicious food. Highly recommend. Good to visit for a group of people or romantic dinner.

Sasha was an excellent server. One of the most stand up gentlemen I've ever met. The food was also excellent. Some of the best pasta I've ever had in New York City. I plan on returning.

Perfectly cooked pasta with tasty italian homestyle sauces. The papadelle dish is a must. As a dessert, I recommend the panna cotta, the black cherry syrup is simply divine!
We had a great meal at this wonderful Italian restaurant.  Pasta made in house daily!

Initially the service was slightly slow (maybe coz the place was packed) but then it picked up. We ate the Burrata, the flatbread, the octopus salad, grilled calamari, mushroom risotto and the lamb shank. All excellent! Definitely recommend and definitely going back. Our cocktails ranged from whiskey sours, to old fashioned and manhattans. By the end of the eve there was a tiny hole in our pockets but well worth it
Great place for a family dinner or a date night. Wonderful ambiance, friendly staff, and delicious food. Their veal and spinach ravioli was exceptionally good, and their wine list is great.

Gorgeous place. I did outdoor dining for a birthday celebration! It's a great Italian spot that host large and small parties. My party of 9, we had a great time, we got drinks, appetizers, each one of us got different entrees and everyone loved the food! Great atmosphere
Rude hosts who wouldn't seat us even though we were here and lots of tables available. Other people had broken arm and they wouldn't seat them either. Extremely inconsiderate. Will not return

great authentic Italian food, quick service & kind staff. The espresso martinis are to die for! Will definitely be coming back.

Amazing food service and drinks!!! Waiter was nice and the service was so quick. Espresso martini was very good too
The food was delicious! I often find that Italian places have very limited vegetarian options, but they had an expansive selection. Plenty of desserts as well!
Amazing specials, pasta, dessert, and service -- Sasha took care of us and explained everything on the menu perfectly, along with great recommendations. Great dinner spot for all!
Seda was the most amazing waitress and the food was delicious. Beautiful outside atmosphere of flowers and string lights. Definitely would come again

My boy friend and I haven't had amazing Italian food in a very long time! Visiting from Wisconsin this restaurant not only was delicious, it has a stunning atmosphere! Seda was excellent as a server and very sweet! Definitely recommend if you're craving Italian food!

Very ambient restaurant. Food was delicious but it did take awhile to come out. However, the waitress (Seda) was so kind and patient when it came to my group ordering dishes. I would come back again for a dinner date next time.
The food was absolutely incredible and the staff so kind. We had the absolute best pappardelle. I could not recommend it more!
Great service, better food. Thanks Ceda! Tiramisu was excellent. Warm, intimate setting.
Get the lamb shank w saffron risotto, don't mind the crowd, and close w tiramisu. You won't getter anything.
The food was AMAZING and fresh. The server was attentive and provided us with some good guidance on dishes and drinks. I will definitely come back here!

I had to ask him myself about specials and he just mumbled and ran through them. Bread wasn't warm and pretty basic. Food was actually pretty good although the grilled squid app was way too small. Consistently amazing food, service and ambiance. Feels so comfortable, very family owned feel and also classy/ charming. The pasta is a dream, muscles are yum so good and the prosciutto w house made buns are to die. Felt very safe during covid dining here. I'm a regular now and so happy that it survived the pandemic. Where would we get THIS AMAZING food from otherwise ?! Can't think of a anywhere better.

Food was amazing! We had the Gnocchi Di Patate and the Veal Ravioli di vitello. The service was great! Carlos was our server.
Great food and great dessert! No reservations and was seated in 5 min. I would highly recommend this please for its homemade pastas and Italian breads.

Da Andrea Ristorante was one of the most amazing restaurant experiences that I'd this year. A vibrant place in New York City but cozy and comfortable at the same time. A menu that won't disappoint any food lover (veggi or not), rich in flavorful options and tastes. The restaurant is fairly small, but the right size for to meet a special person for a good wine and a nice conversation, accompanied by a delicious meal. Comfortable environment, excellent food, nice crowd, just THE place to go for a great dinner with your special company!
We went to Da Andrea hungry for homemade noodles and were not disappointed! Come eat here if you're hungry for the perfect pasta dish.

Found about it few months ago and came several times. Food is great, and service is amazing.
Wonderful time here! The pasta was amazing. Sasha in particular had great service would totally recommend next time!
Amazing service and the vibes were immaculate. I had the carbonara and the flavor was great. Would go here again!

Christian was our waiter. He was a really energetic waiter with great energy and brought our food in good timing. All the foods were delicious and the hospitality was really nice. The Margherita pizza was exceptional as well as all the pastas. The medium done salmon fillet was very tender, juicy and infused with flavor. Would recommend anyone to come here
Really great atmosphere with a beautiful outdoor floral arrangement! Good food and very friendly wait staff

It was my first time at the restaurant.  The service was good and my food was fine. The reason I am writing this review is to let people know that their outdoor dining is really indoor dining. The outdoor structure was completely enclosed. It felt more crowded than indoor. We ended up eating indoor because it appeared to be a better option. If you want to eat outdoor with heating lamp, this is not the place. This may be a good place when the weather is warmer If you want to eat outdoor.

Such a quaint date night location. Great ambiance, soft music but not too loud for conversation. Excellent homemade pasta selection that is made in house. Beautiful flower decor for outdoor dining area. Covered enough for a quick shower but not entirely enclosed for a full blown storm. Wait staff was highly trained and gave great recommendations. The mushroom ravioli was 10/10. Highly recommend for an intimate date night that is nice but not over the top.
Great food, service, ambiance and price point. Outdoor setting is great! Carlos was extremely attentive. We very much enjoyed the evening.

Da Andrea has every reason to be proud of what its chef produces in the kitchen and how its staff represents the restaurant. We had impeccable food that was served with brisk yet attentive politeness on a Friday night when the restaurant was slammed. I was amazed by how smoothly our servers kept things running. There was no lag time in waiting for our food and there was not a moment when anyone we interacted with was anything less than completely gracious. The restaurant itself is in a cozy, attractive space and (on the Friday night we were there, at least) seems to attract a younger crowd that handles themselves with maturity. On the downside, the dining room got VERY loud due to the sheer number of diners, making conversation difficult. My partner, who does a lot of restaurant architecture work, mentioned to me that the walls could have been soundproofed more to absorb some of that noise. Luckily, I was so busy stuffing my face with good food that I wasn't too sad about the lack of conversation. I would love to try Da Andrea again someday during a quieter time slot because it offers an outstanding restaurant experience without the Michelin-star prices.

My husband and I often have dinners there. Friendly impeccable service, great food and wines, excellent atmosphere. We love Mannan--he and actually all the staff do an excellent job making sure your evening will be beautiful. We've never been disappointed!
Great food, great atmosphere, great service. I really liked the artichoke ravioli. The outdoor seating is pleasant and heated.
This place is beautiful and the drinks are delicious. Staff is friendly and attentive and food was mouth watering and delicious
This place is a MUST when visiting the city. The floral decor and excellent service and food makes this place a wonderful experience! If you can get Carlos, he's awesome!

Went here for a family dinner. The waiter was so nice and recommended their "signature dish," the pappardelle. Was beyond impressed. I studied in Florence and it was equally as good as the pasta over there. Highly recommend it. Such nice outdoor seating as well.

Beautiful ambiance, attentive and caring servers and staff. Overall great experience. Had the carbonara, cavatelli, and their homemade apple tart. Pasta was delicious and so was their fresh focaccia! Will be coming back!
It's a beautiful restaurant with really good freshly made pastas! It also has a lot of indoor seats. I never have to wait during the brunch tome

Came here for a birthday dinner recently. Two convenient parking garages on the same street. Good COVID precautions in place, you're very close to the people next to you but it wasn't a problem as the glass blocks out sound. Ordered the calamaretti, outstanding. Spaghetti carbonara with bacon was excellent. Tiramisu is a must have. All food came out very quickly. Definitely recommend!

Food and drink was amazing. Carlos is a wonderful waiter very prompt and friendly! Outdoor seating was beautiful and had a wonderful ambiance.

Great vibe, lovely wine, homey, casual, intimate. Service is amaaaaazing (seda is the sweetest!), but food did take a while. Otherwise, would definitely come again! Mussels were divine.
Marco was so sweet! Super friendly with our table and checked up on us frequently! Food was delicious definitely worth it.

Incredible spot. Great ambiance, service, and food. Highly recommend enjoying a white white and the gnocchi in their outdoor area. Carlos was a true treat... he made us feel at home!
We ate here and the food was fantastic! Carlos was an amazing waiter and was so friendly thanks Carlos for the great service!!!
The food was fantastic. We had an excellent experience. Very authentic. I recommend the tiramisu! Our waiter was extremely professional.

Great pasta, great location, friendly service. Highly recommend.
Very cute spot with a great atmosphere. If you're looking for a nice brunch spot with delicious food, this is your place! Carlos was our server and was very charismatic and helpful!

the food was delicious! definitely get the lasagna and would also highly recommend the squid dish (appetizer i believe) it was phenomenal. there's only two bathrooms which isn't a big complain of mine we just had to wait a while. the food takes a while to come out but definitely worth the experience

The assorted bread basket was a 5 out of 5, and the dessert - a chocolate walnut cake with caramel ice cream, plus two complimentary almond cookies - was, like, out of this world good. Phenomenal carbs. The main course was great, I think I should have gotten a different side than the butternut squash but overall a great experience. Fantastically kind service as well - and beautiful decor!

Went here for brunch and absolutely loved it! Super cozy inside with an old Italian feel. We sat outside under the beautiful floral arch surrounded by greenery. It's perfect for brunch with the girls or date night. There was live music playing and the staff was so attentive and polite. Our server Tanya answered all of our questions and gave the best menu suggestions. We started with the Amalfitana, which was delicious!!  I had the Pennette Con Salmone, also delicious. The pasta is hand made and tastes so fresh (10/10).  Ended with a very tasty tiramisu. Can't go wrong with that. The service, the ambiance and the food were all amazing.  Honestly I can't wait to go back!

If you're looking for some great Italian dishes, this is your place. They have a daily menu that I highly suggest but their actual menu is also amazing. No matter what you pick, you can't go wrong with it.
Fantastic food here! Great wine and cocktails. Ambiance is great with flowers and seating outdoors. Marco, our waiter, was 10/10.
Da Andrea was fantastic! Our server Marco was great, we had a really great experience. Highly recommend!

We sat outside for dinner tonight and i loved my frangola frise and my friend ordered rosemary spirits by the recommendation of our server Seda. If you like a dinner outside with a summer vibe, go for it, they made a great job as of the atmosphere. Thank you Da Andrea!

Had dinner on a rainy evening.  The staff was excellent and abundant unlike many other places who desparately need help.  The food was excellent.  We shared calamari which was cooked to perfection on the grill - extremely tender.  Chef nailed it.  I got the grilled shrimp - again grilled to perfection.  My wife got cavatelli with shrimp and salmon.  She raved about it.  Finally I made a note that we were celebrating her birthday and they made her a little treat after dinner and sang Happy Birthday.  We'll be back - great experience.
Great food, drink and ambiance, indoor and out. Loved the Salmon, Bloody Mary, and chocolate walnut cake.

This place is absolutely amazing! It is so gorgeous and so beautiful. The vibe was amazing and so lovely. The people were so nice and the food was to die for. We ended up sitting next to the owner and he was so nice. He was a very sweet family man and you can tell he cares so much about the customers. Great place overall!!!
Fantastic homemade pesto! I love the vibe it's feels so authentic. Highly recommend if you want authentic Italian.

The food was super delicious and the ambiance was really cute! The outdoor space looked really lovely. We were unable to sit outdoors due to the weather but would return to sit outside. The parpadelle with truffle oil was fantastic. We had a great time and would definitely go again.

It was excellent service and brilliant food! We had the gnocchi, spaghetti with clams, and cavatelli and we were all extremely impressed. Not to mention very attentive waiters and lovely ambiance. Would highly recommend.

Wonderful experience! The ambiance was gorgeous, staff was so attentive and fast. I had the gnocchi which was delicious!! Best I've ever had, so creamy and fresh out of the kitchen. Definitely recommend!!

One of the best Italian restaurants in town. The flavor of the food is just a 10/10. Some of the most authentic I've had in NYC and one of the spots that reminds me of my trip to Italy the most. I've been going to this restaurant for about 7 years, and I love it every time.

Came here with gals on a whim in a rainy Saturday night. We ducked in and were immediately greeted by our wonderful server and some on the house foccacia. Not enough restaurants do bread service anymore. My wine and pasta was magnificent.
Great experience! Our server Marco was attentive and the food was amazing! Highly recommend!
Marco was our server and he was super attentive and sweet. Great food. Will come here again!
Lovely ambiance with amazing wine list, pasta dishes and salads for reasonable prices. Great for date night. Will be returning. Staff is also lovely and welcoming.

Fantastic food. Everything from the bread they served as a free appetizer to the entree I got which is the penne eggplant mozzarella to the quick service. This place is a great little Italian spot. The ambience gives The Godfather 2 restaurant scene vibes. It's simple and pretty dim lit. The servers are very prompt and give good suggestions. The manager was also accommodating even though we arrived late to our reservation and had 1 more person than was told. Overall very positive dining experience. They verify your vaccination card so make sure you have it with you. Will recommend and go go again

Host was very accommodating, location is beautiful, our server was prompt and helpful. The food was delicious and everything came out perfectly. Thanks for the wonderful dinner.

column3: North San Jose, San Jose, CA
column6: Great ambiance. Not as much impressed by their food. It's probably didn't work for me. Portion size wasn't that much for the price.

Absolutely loved this place! The ultimate cozy, authentic Italian dinner. Everything we ate was incredible! Make sure you get a couple of pastas and ask about their daily soup. Great wine, great service, great music, absolutely amazing food.

we had James as our server and he was really kind and attentive during the whole time which made our experience more pleasant. food was good- my fav was triangolo cioccolato and risotto with spinach (i added shrimp) romantic vibes and good for intimate dinner! cw to go back
Da Andrea kicks ass.  I hope no one discovers it.   I order a bottle of amarone and two specials with great service.  Never had a bad experience.  This is a neighborhood gem.
Food was amazing here! Definitely worth it! Seda was definitely the biggest sweetheart who made our experience here the best! Definitely recommend it!
No comment

Come to this place for the food and outdoor setting. Skip for basic customer service and cramped indoor dining. We live nearby and have been a couple times before. When we were sat at a 2-top right near the bar, with the breeze from the door blowing on us and my chair being bumped several times, I didn't bat an eye. When a waiter dropped a glass of wine on the floor and it splashed on my jacket and shoes, I accepted the apology - things happen, right? The easiest thing to do would have been to buy me a drink and no hard feelings. But no, when we got the check not a thing was comped. I'm supposed to pay for the privilege of being bumped and spilled on? When we complained to our waiter he stated he didn't know about it (despite no less than 4 staff members being involved in the cleaning up process). Fine - again, we are native New Yorkers and times are hard, always giving the benefit of the doubt. They come back only to comp my partner's coffee and a dessert we shared, about half the price of 1 drink I ordered. When we were leaving, a manager asked how our meal went, and we honestly relayed our disappointment with the customer service. Not one thing was done to rectify the situation. I feel we have been more than generous in giving chances to this restaurant, but the service is significantly lacking.

I've been here twice, once for a special occasion, and once for a regular occasion we wanted to make feel like a special occasion. Both experiences were quite good.  They have nice drink options including a good cocktail menu, authentic Italian cuisine including dishes that aren't on your standard menu, and desserts that are hard to pass up. The outdoor sidewalk dining is in a well-built shelter (one of our visits was on a wet, cold and windy night) and sidewalk service is pretty solid.
Do not recommend. Service was good. Food was not - there are better options for Italian. All of our dishes seemed to lack flavor and freshness. Sorry.

The outdoor seating is very beautiful, if not a little cramped. Service in general was okay. They were very busy and a little disorganized. After we ordered and they took our menus, another waiter came by to try to give us menus again and tell us the specials. I'd rather them be doubly attentive, than a long wait! I ordered the risotto special, which was risotto with monkfish and it was not flavorful at all. Tasted like cream, with no Parmesan or salty flavoring. Monkfish was also bland. The waitress took the meal off  the bill, with no issues.

Cute place with average food and drinks. Nothing special. Given the prices I expected a bit more.

Great experience here. Sat us quick on a busy Friday, food was fantastic, service was great, reasonable pricing. Highly recommend.
pretty dry carbonara.. not enough flavoring. but nice biscuit dessert for free at end
Had such a great time tonight at Da Andrea! Wouldn't have been the same without our amazing server Nicholas!
Amazing service and delicious food! I had the mushroom truffle risotto :) James was our server and he was great!!

Whenever someone comes to visit me in New York, this is the first place I take them. It's such a charming neighborhood spot, not to mention some of the tastiest pasta I've ever had! The bread and pastas are house made - always fresh - and the wine list is well curated. The staff is incredibly knowledgable and warm.
Omg, food is so good, service is so great, our waiter is so sweet! Loved our evening here :)
Great food and good service, I would definitely recommend one of their cocktails! The atmosphere was super cozy and a great place to go with friends
Excellent atmosphere! Great food!! Loved everything about this place, I don't think I can say anything negative about it at all! Amazing service!
Friendly staff and awesome food. They also have a super cute outdoor setting. Highly recommend!
One of my favorite Italian restaurants in Greenwich Village. I had dinner with my family here on Monday night. It's not too crowded or loud. I ordered mixed seafood, so delicious!
Amazing! Live music is of the true pro level. Food was just great. The waiter was probably new: very polite but the food order was a bit off.

From the moment you enter, you let out a breath and relax. This is how a Tuscan restaurant tucked into the city should feel. The smells and the colors appropriately set the town. The customer service is friendly and helpful. The star though - the food. The gnocchi was perfectly cooked with a dreamy cream sauce. The ravioli was stuffed like a pillow. The starters were so good we had to make ourselves stop because more was coming. Stop, have a glass of wine and enjoy Da Andrea. You will appreciate the experience and you will be back.

K and I had talked about checking out Da Andrea for years and finally got around to it last night. We were so glad we did! The spaghetti carbonara was sensational, as was the sea bass special. Simple ingredients done very well - the hallmark of great Italian food. I'm giving it 4 stars because the timing and service was a little spotty. After being seated we waited almost 15 minutes for menus! Once we ordered we waited another 10 minutes for cocktails and bread, then barely had a few minutes to enjoy either before the meal came. Otherwise the meal was excellent and we will definitely be back.
Love this place! I keep coming back for their delicious hand made pasta. Their gnocchi is out of the world. And the decor is simply wow! Highly recommend checking it out.

Mixed feelings about this popular spot.  We were a party of 8. Food was quite good but the portions very small and the prices were high.  Service wasn't great but it was tough on the masked servers as the noise level inside was high.   Several requests were either not heard, forgotten or ignored.   In the past 4 star experience

I was not quite sure wether to give the restaurant two or three stars but honestly due to the staff of the restaurant I'm going to give it 2 stars. The food was really good but portions were somewhat small. Now with the staff.. they were rude and slow and never came around to see how we were doing or if we needed anything else.

This is one place I'm going to have to disagree with the other yelp reviews. I've walked by this place quite a few times and have always been impressed by the vibe. We were able to get a reservation pretty easily. When we arrived and actually saw the setup, it was a bit concerning. Yes there are shields in place but you can literally reach out and touch the diner next to you from another party!! Yes I know there's a shield but it didn't make for a comfortable dining experience. Service was ok, nothing special. There was nothing in the pasta section of the menu that really stood out to me, which is pretty rare. I ended up going with the eggplant pasta, which didn't have much flavor even though the menu stated spicy tomato sauce. Given the high reviews, i definitely had a different experience than most. S
So glad we went to this restaurant! The service was amazing along with the food! Seda was a delight! Will be returning when I come back to NYC :)
Wonderful restaurant. Flowers and decor was beautiful. Marco did a wonderful job as our server.

Worth the wait! Ask for waiter, Marco ~ handsome, kind and made our birthday celebration magical! Recommend - apps: octopus & burrata, entree: pappardelle & dessert: tiramisu

Such an adorable and romantic restaurant. Beautiful outdoor ambiance with live music on Saturday and Sunday. Food was good. Got the salmon with Brussels sprout salad. Very fresh. Prosciutto with burrata was delicious. They accommodated party of 6 outside. Definitely recommend.
Absolutely amazing service!!! Our waiter Carlos was such a great host! The food was served super fast and it was SOO good! Must go!! The pasta was so delicious !! I will def be returning!

Thus placed was recommended by the Hotel I was staying in. I would have not otherwise known about it. My husband had lamb chops and I had Spaghetti with Ragu sauce. My brother in law had a vegetarian pasta dish that included eggplant. We all enjoyed our food and felt it was a good choice. The waiters did not make us feel rushed and we sat ate and talked about yester years. I had a glass of wine and really enjoyed the evening. If you are in NY and haven't tried this you may want to give it a try. Especially if you are not looking for over crowded tourist spots. Sorry no pics we were too hungry and in deep conversation.

The village is chock-full of Italian restaurants. I found this one on a quiet side street on a rainy evening. The soft lighting and well worn interior  was met by a friendly waiter. Sat at a cozy table and had a house wine. The menu has all the usual but the specials were interesting. Had medallions of beef in a mushroom reduction with mash which was well plated  and delicious. The wait staff were friendly and attentive. Overall great place.
Had a lovely time here! Food was delicious and soo fresh, ambience on point and the service was impeccable. I will most certainly be going back!!

I've been here several times and the food here is consistently great, friendly staff and prices are reasonable. This place is always packed even during the weekdays so reservations are recommended or just try to get there early to avoid a long wait. Since my first visit many years ago I always stick to the same order of the pappardelle and house red wine. The flavor of the sauce is delicious and there is a good amount of meat so it's quite hardy. The carbonara pasta is heavier but also delicious if you prefer a creamier white sauce. The grilled octopus is done very well. I tried the cavatelli once and this was the one dish that was unimpressive in my opinion. On my last visit we had the chocolate walnut cake with caramel ice cream and I found the cake to be hard like it was frozen and they didn't thaw it out. It was also lacking in flavor and not worth the extra calories. The portions are generous so I'm usually to stuffed for dessert and based on the chocolate cake I am not missing out on anything special.

We went here for dinner on Christmas evening. The restaurant has a rustic, romantic ambience and it wasn't too crowded that evening which was a plus. The service was nice and attentive. We ordered the lentil soup and burrata for appetizers. Both were excellent! For the main course, I ordered the mediterranean pasta and my husband ordered the grilled chicken. I was a little underwhelmed by the pasta. It tasted fine but nothing special. The grilled chicken was really good. We ended our meal with the Tiramisu which was definitely the highlight of the evening and was accompanied by cookies (compliments of the chef). In all, we had a great dining experience at Da Andrea and it's a perfect date night spot.

We found this place based on location and good reviews.  Our first night, Valentines Day, we got take out.  The bartender was very, very nice and constantly checked on our order.  She was awesome!  Tigelle buns were awesome!  Loved the Straccetti integrali!  We went back the next night due to the great experience the night before.  This time we tried the pappardelle and gnocchetti.  Both very enjoyable!  Tiramisu and creme brûlée were great!  The place is a little small inside so it's probably a good idea to get a reservation.  Staff was very nice!  Definitely check it out in the village!

The ambiance of this place was incredible! The service was out of this world as was the food. A great place to hang with company and enjoy one another. Long dinners here are a must!
Get the seafood pesto! Its amazing! Also, Seda is a sweetheart. Would definitely recommend!
Really delicious food! Everyone at the table loved their food. Ambience and service was also really well done. There is heated outdoor seating!
Fantastic pasta -- my artichoke ravioli was some of the best I've had. Highly recommend this restaurant and wonderful ambiance!

Da Andrea is easily one of my favorite restaurants in NYC. I first came here in 2019 for a friend's birthday and have been wanting to come back ever since. I was finally able to make it back yesterday with my roommate and her sister and we had such a great experience! We started with the mussels which were incredible. It was my first time having mussels and the sauce that they came in was so good, we we eating it like soup. My roommate and I got the bolognese which was absolutely delicious, and her sister got the ricotta cavatelli which was amazing. The pasta is made fresh and you absolutely can tell the difference! We ended with the apple tart, creme brûlée and an espresso martini which were delightful, and it was the perfect way to finish an outstanding meal. Our waiter James was so welcoming and even let us know they have brunch on the weekend with live music, so we will definitely be back! If you're in the area I highly recommend coming here.
Great Italian spot with traditional dishes. Great service. Love their outdoor seating area.

column3: Newfield - Westover - Turn of River, Stamford, CT
column6: Good service & a great romantic date spot. COVID conscious and quiet quaint ambience. Recommend the homemade pasta selection!

Had an amazing experience at Da Andrea! We were enamored with the ambiance; at a table with open windows and beautiful decor we felt transported to Italy. The pastas were amazing *Gnocchi *Ravioli *Fettuccine, cocktails were amazing, and the tiramisu was delicious. Customer service was perfect. A great way to end a Saturday night
This place has the most amazing calamari and pasta. Drinks are delicious and service was awesome. Awesome vibes for a night out. Highly recommend.
Excellent service, great cocktails, cozy atmosphere, and delicious meal. !!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
Beautiful ambience, great value, and a quick, fun-spirited staff. Great date night spot - check it out!
If your in the mood for homemade pasta this is the place! Super romantic, or the perfect girls night out. Our server, Seda, recommended the perfect drink! Can't wait to come back
lovely restaurant with a beautiful exterior! Seda was a great server and we loved our girls night out at this restaurant! I recommend the Fragola Fizz cocktail with one of their homemade pastas!

I've had the pleasure of dining at this restaurant a number of times over the past 10 years and have always enjoyed it. My most recent visit was no exception and in fact was probably the best it's ever been. I had the carpaccio to begin and a special veal scallopini in a mushroom and truffle sauce and broccoli rabe. Both were top notch, as was our server James and the rest of the warm and hospitable staff. The restaurant recently decorated their outdoor setup with a grove of pink flowers, which is absolutely beautiful. If you're looking for a little bit of Italy in Manhattan, look no further than Da Andrea!

This restaurant was fabulous! It is definitely one of my top recommendations for anyone visiting the city, especially during the holidays. The decor is unbelievable and the service is exquisite. Christian, our waiter, was extremely attentive and gave us great recommendations for wine and for food. I would definitely recommend coming here on your next night out in the big apple.
The chicken palliard was delicious! Very traditional. Christian was an amazing waiter who was very attentive and brought great energy.
No comment
The food was great and very reasonably priced. Also great service, our server Sasa treated us well! He really added to the experience and made my last day in New York a nice one!

Such a wonderful meal in a fun romantic atmosphere! Fantastic service from Marco and great drinks, antipasti and fresh pasta. Outdoors has beautiful flowers as well, would be great for special occasions or a nice dinner date!

The food was INCREDIBLE! If you come here you need to get the mushroom ravioli veal pasta ... it was too good. the service is very fast and good. thanks to Seda our waitress for all the recommendations!
The food was fantastic, and Seda was an amazing server!! Could not have had a better experience! Squid ink pasta was 10/10!

Came here for a solo enjoyable lunch and had one of the worst dining experiences I've ever had in NYC. The waiter was rude and quite arrogant. Also there were two other old male patrons sitting next to me that were blatantly rude, negatively commenting on what I ordered (weird right?) and just all around adding to an oddly chauvinistic experience. Packed up my $60 lunch (ridiculous) and left quickly. All in all, 0/10. Never going back; wouldn't recommend.
I had dinner here and not only was it delicious, but our waiter, Sasha, was incredible. He made the experience amazing. Highly recommended.
Sasha is the best. Wine knowledge to the max. Def recommend and will be coming back for the specials and the wine Of course.
No comment
We came for a birthday dinner and the service and food were delicious! The pasta was delicious and the server was very good with his wine recommendation!
No comment

Fun, quiet atmosphere with great service! We went for dinner on a Saturday night and had a great meal. I got a special which was risotto with calamari and corn and it was amazing. As someone with a gluten allergy, there was not a ton of options for me but I enjoyed my meal! My dad got the pork chop with apples, which he enjoyed. My boyfriend got the stuffed chicken and it was stuffed with a lot of cheese! The caprese salad came with a lot of cheese and tomatoes and a wonderful pesto sauce on top. The wine was also fabulous! I would definitely return!

Seda was the best server and the food was all amazing. We got the straccetti, mushroom rav pasta with veal, Bolognese, and squid ink pasta all were amazing!! Also get the prosciutto anti pasta with the little pancake things AMAZING

Great food in a great setting!.   In town for a quick 24 hour stop and dropped in here for dinner, the food was delicious!. I had the risotto special, my wife the squid & clams with pasta and my son simple pasta with butter and parmesan.  There were no scraps left on any plates!.  Dessert was wonderful, chocolate cake with salted ice cream!.

We made a reservation for dinner for 4. The outdoor seating was comfortable and accommodating, with heaters on top. Our server was very knowledgeable and helpful, quick and kind. The support staff were all very nice as well. We had the burrata and carpaccio (both great), pasta carbonara (really good) and a few other dishes. For desert we had the cream Brûlée' and pan a cotta (nice but not more). Great food and genuinely nice service. We will be back!
the pasta was fresh and yummy and wow, def coming back here. shoutout to our server marco who made the experience a 10/10!! best place for a  gals night

Great place with very nice and intimate outdoor seating. Wine and food choices were absolutely delicious. We left very full and happy. I was excited to see so many authentic options on the menu so I could really get what I enjoyed.
This place was absolutely amazing! Pasta was cooked to perfection. And the service by Sasha was excellent! Very friendly and accommodating. Go here!!
Seda was a great server! I loved the ambiance of the restaurant. Food was delicious and is a great place to grab dinner with your friends.
Amazing service and great food. Would definitely come back and recommend it for a date night. Sasha our waiter helped us out so much with what was best on the menu!
Sasha was our waiter and very nice and helped me pick out my entree. Parpadella was amazing
Delivery arrived hot to eat and the pastas were great! The pappardelle with sweet sausage Ragu is very good - the truffle oil isn't too overpowering.

All food was delicious and the service was good. Would definitely come back. Carbonara, flatbread, chicken pilliard, and tartare were great, as were the drinks! Would do again any day. A great Italian place in the neighborhood.
No comment
Da Andrea had an excellent vibe to it. The food was great, the drinks were delicious, and the service was outstanding. Would highly recommend Seda, she was an amazing waitress.
Food is amazing and service by Sasa is even better! Tigelle buns and pappardelle are super yummy.
No comment
Food was SO delicious!!! Sat outside with barriers between the tables. Highly recommend if you're looking for tasty Italian food!

good pasta and ambience in the restaurant. i got the clam pasta ans my friend got the risotto. it was overall a good experience. the decor inside and outside was gorgeous as well and it was very clean. i also love that the location is in greenwich village. it's a quiet fun place to walk around after. our server carlos was great! he really gave great food suggestions and made our experience enjoyable. i would come again!
such a beautiful entrance with the flowers and the music. our server Sasha was such a pleasure to have with fantastic recommendations and service.

Sat outside with a friend for brunch on Saturday. Live guitarist playing good tunes to listen to while enjoying our meal and catching up. Food was delicious, as usual. The only constructive criticism that I can offer is that my menu had different prices than my friend's menu by $2-3. The higher prices were correct.

Absolutely lovely meal and service - if I could give Da Andrea more than five stars I would. Their house-made pasta is some of the best I've ever had. The entire experience felt authentic and welcoming, we walked away already thinking about the next meal - will definitely be returning!
Carlos was an amazing server! Super attentive and accommodating. Definitely recommend
Extremely cute outdoor seating, the servers are attentive, and the food and drink was delicious.

After being away from the city for a year, I couldn't wait to return to my beloved Da Andrea. Everything was just as I remembered it. The prosciutto with homemade buns and papardelle with sausage and truffle oil have been a go-to comfort meal for years. The new outdoor dining enclosure is beautiful and held up to a major downpour. In a city with so many options I rarely go back to the same place twice. I've been coming back to Da Andrea countless times for years.
Absolutely lovely. Everything we ordered was incredible and our waitress gave us some complimentary limoncello which was darling. 11/10 recommend!
No comment

Da Andrea you are simply fantastic, I had an incredible experience here today. Menu, location, staff and ambiance are all the reasons why I enjoy this place. I was advised to try their Veal and Spinach Ravioli, which was outstanding, but all other menu items were great too. Staff is extremely pleasant and will help you with everything. I will certainly come back to Da Andrea.

Carlos and marco were amazing amazing servers! Such great service- they were friendly and  so helpful. Needless to say, the food was fabulous. The freshest pasta with the authentic Italian cuisine experience. Definitely becoming a go-to of mine! Thank you Da Andrea for such a great service.
No comment
Fantastic food and excellent service . Our server, Monique made us the best drink and paced our food so that we  had a relaxing and enjoyable  culinary experience.
We went out during Covid and sat outside and felt very safe. Staff was super polite and timely and the food is always awesome. It's our neighborhood spot
the best date spot! our waitress Tanya was so sweet and provided excellent service! the outdoor seating is beautiful and the food is fresh and great quality! I recommend the ppardelle!
Excellent service- Tanya was great and the food came out very quickly. The food was great, we had the eggplant penne and spaghetti carbonara. Both were so yummy!
No comment

We were attracted by the florals arrangements. The food was fantastic along with the presentation. Our waiter was super attentive. Overall I highly recommend this place and would definitely come back here again

Went with 2 friends for a nice dinner. The ambiance was wonderful and the service was excellent. Perfect night with great food and be sure to ask for Carlos as your server! He was very attentive and made sure to check in with us about the food and our experience in general.
Amazing food and ambiance! Carlos was our waiter and was very lovely and attentive! Also the price was right. Would definitely come back here again.
The service is typically friendly here, and it's relatively quiet which is nice. Unfortunately, the food is very bland. I had the gnocchi and the apple tart, and neither had any flavor at all.

Our waiter Marco was absolutely AMAZING !! He was so attentive and personable and literally one of my favorite waiters I've ever had. I think I may come back here just for him lol!!! Italians, I have learned, are verrrry picky about eating Italian food in the USA. We showed up a bit before 5 pm when the place hadn't yet opened. The waiters and everyone were very friendly, and allowed my elderly parents to use the bathroom before we went to park the car. The stairs (just a few) leading in to the restaurant were a bit hard for my parents, but not too bad. Had they known there were stairs, they probably would have vetoed the place, though. We would have missed out. We were seated at a pleasant table in the front window, and quickly brought tasty focaccia and bread. The appetizers pleased everyone--grilled squid with a corn salad surprised my uncle (pleasantly). He had thought it would be fried, but he liked it. I had mushrooms with polenta and gorgonzola cheese--delish! My mom had a lentil soup that she said was just perfect--not too tarted up, just tasty and hearty. My dad liked the Caprese salad--fresh mozz with a pesto sauce. The entrees were also hits--the roasted chicken ravioli special, the pappardelle with sausage, the gnocchi with pesto and shrimp, and a grilled shrimp entree. The side of broccoli rabe was fine, nothing mind-blowing. For dessert, we tried the tiramisu (nice) and an apple tart with delicious caramel-y ice cream. With our coffees, they gave tasty little biscotti with a dipping sauce that mystified us. We could not tell WHAT it was. Overall, we were impressed, and very satisfied with our food. Three picky Italians all complimented me for finding such a great, neighborhood-y restaurant.

The must go place for great homemade hearty pasta. Be sure not to get too greedy and over order because the portions are large with great prices. All of the pasta dishes are $13 and below. For appetizer, the prosciutto with warm flat bun is absolutely divine. Also, get their house wine and enjoy a good tasting wine for an extremely reasonable price. They don't take reservations, but the service is friendly and prompt. It is a charming place with nice exposed brick walls making it great for any occasion.
Homemade pasta dishes that surely don't disappoint.  Very affordable as well especially for great tasting Italian food.

Having been to Italy and experience the complete meal, Da Andrea's atmosphere made me feel I was back in the southern port city of Brindisi. They have a wide selection of great wines and food. The smoked mussels as antipasti is great with Moscato d'Asti. The veal ravioli with spinach was a great first course and followed it up with the hanger steak. All in all a great meal.

About 12 of us went to Da Andrea for a bridal dinner on a Thursday night and surprisingly, it was a packed house!  The restaurant is charming (though a bit small) and serves authentic Italian cuisine.  The braised portobello with rosemary oil, polenta and gorgonzola cheese was de-lish.  The thinly sliced beef served with arugula (yummy!!!), parmesan and heart of palm was fantastic (though the beef is raw).  And the prosciutto with flat buns is to die for!  For entree, I had the mixed seafood in tomato broth - it was filled with mussels, squid, fish, shrimp and a scallop - very satisfying.  For dessert, order the strawberry gelati - it is so fresh and sweet!  Would totally return!

I made a reservation for 14, but because of last minute changes, it went down to 10. The staff was very flexible with that. The staff was so friendly and lovable! Not only that, the food itself was good. I ordered the spaghetti with spicy tomato sauce and for dessert, hazelnut gelato. SO AMAZING .
Came with four other friends and we each ordered different items. I got the squid ink pasta and caprese, liked the pasta so much because you can really taste the texture of the pasta.

I came here on a cold Saturday night in winter with two of my girlfriends. We were looking for a restaurant last minute and had NO reservations anywhere. We made a rash decision to come here. We walked in and a gentleman said "table for three? We'll figure something out." We were sat in 45 minutes. Very small, quaint, delightful place. Pretty good wine and the food was delicious!! Excited to go back!

Excellent home made ravioli and even better prosciutto buns as an app. The food and ambience is fulfilling and comforting which is what I personally seek in a good Italian establishment. I highly recommend this place if you are visiting and are staying on the path as there is an entrance to path around the corner.

This is our go to for affordable and comfortable italian.  We are regular delivery customers (probably 1x / week) and their delivery is incredibly fast.  I adore their spaghetti bolognese and the tower of vegetables but everything is good.  Have only been to the restaurant once, but we sat outside and it was a very nice experience.

Decent food at decent prices with cheap house wine = win.  This small quaint little italian place feels home-y without feeling too cramped.  It can get a little on the louder side, and it does get busy.  We ordered 4 different pastas, the prosciutto appetizer, and of course their house red which was half a bottle for $14, which is perfect for me cuz my wife doesnt drink, and I'd rather not finish a whole bottle every time I go eat with her..  If you are in the neighborhood its worth a try.  The food I would say is about 3, but atmosphere, and prices probably propel it to 3.5-4 star territory.
The grilled goat cheese vegetable tower, pappardelle and artichoke ravioli were all so delicious. The house red is Montepulciano you can't beat that. We will definitely be back!

came here for date night. we ordered the baby spinach and fennel appetizer - wasn't that great, probably wouldn't order again. both of us ordered the pappardelle with truffle oil, which was pretty good - it had a nice truffle flavor. i got the prosecco (white wine) which was okay but not as sweet as I would have liked. service was fast, our waiter was attentive, and the experience was great. would recommend for dinner.

SO DELICIOUS, and reasonably priced. When we walked in at 7PM on a Wednesday night, the place was PACKED with old Italian men. That is a surefire way to know the place rocks. Old men know their sh*t. The place is adorable. Wait staff is SUPER nice. The food is fantastic. We started with the flat buns. That prosciutto was sliced so nice and thin, it all melted in your mouth. We got a complimentary portobello mushroom dish that came with a polenta souffle sort of thing with gooey gorgonzola on the inside. Holy crap, so delicious. GET THAT. For the entree, I had fresh papardelle with sausage and truffle oil. Delicious, but maybe a tad too salty. Desserts were great. Recommend the tiramisu and apple tart. Skip the cookie platter.
This is my 3rd time having dinner here and the food is still delicious and a good value.  Service is still excellent and I continue to rate it very highly!!!

Visiting from California and was told by a couple that we met while dining at a restaurant in china town that for great Italian food we had to come here!! Will definitely be coming back on our next visit to the big apple.

This place is terrific.  The food is delicious and lovingly prepared, the prices are reasonable for the quality, taste and location, and the service is attentive and warm without being invasive.  If possible, ask to sit in Sandra's section.  She always makes a great meal and wonderful dining experience even more special.

Excellent Italian food, love the restaurant, service and the food. I ordered the organic salad and homemade spaghetti with meat sauce bolognese. Very fresh, tasty and perfectly cooked. I can recommend this place. I will be back the next time I am in the area.

Great food for some awesome prices, especially in the village. Didn't have to wait longer than 5 minutes and had courteous and attentive service. Good spot!

This risotto made me so, so happy. So happy. I probably ate some other things, too, that were good, but I had a transcendental experience with the risotto. The staff was helpful and professional. The place was busy in a good way. Everything about it made me happy. Either I have to go back here everyday or I can never go back again. I haven't decided.

Wow, that took me by surprise.  5 of us ended up here on a Saturday night in the summer.  I looked to Yelp for an Italian suggestion in Flatiron/Village, and came up with this.  We were not disappointed.  The ravioli special was excellent (chicken and mushroom, I believe).  Everybody loved their entrees.  The service was friendly, and the wine list was pretty good (a few $20-something bottles).

Delicious and very friendly restaurant.  We had spaghetti bolognese and salmon/shrimp pesto. Very good. The staff was very friendly and attentive. The tiramisu was some some of the best I've had. We'll be back.
Small place but nice quiet atmosphere.  Food was tasty and not too badly priced.  Flat buns with the prosciutto was good, as was the veal ravioli
Yum. Reasonably priced. My entree was the Risotto of the day. My appetizer was the Polenta with mushrooms and gorgonzola. Both were delightful. It's not too noisy. Will return. Happily.
Intimate Italian restuarant! All the food looked delicious, and I choose the butternut squash gnocchi! Loved the atmosphere and there was no wait...

I love italian food and this place does not disappoint.  The fresh pasta and fresh appetizers were absolutely amazing.  Friends took me here for my birthday.  Its a bit small but tuscan-y cozy.  I had a special ravioli dish but tried some of my other friends' dishes.  Everything was so fresh and flavorful.  Will definitely come back.

It's been a while since I've reviewed but I never neglected Yelp, as it helped me find this amazing restaurant! Me and my girlfriends had just gotten out of the Fuerza Bruta show in Union Sq. and we were starving so we found this place. When you walk in, it is rather small but super cozy and warm. we waited for a table for no more than 10 minutes and the waitress was nice and dealt with my inability to order fast and tendency to scan the entire menu 10 times lol. I had the penne pasta with eggplant and mozzerella; and white wine (Pinot Grigio to be exact). The food was delicious. This is not your typical italian restaurant.

3.5 Very well priced place. Great food, good portions. Is it fine dining? Nope, but it is still tasty.
Love this little place. It's unassuming and the food is delicious. Parpadelle is my favorite. We also get the vegetable tower as well. YUM!
This place was great! Service was excellent, wonderful food and even better wonderful price! Portion sizes were perfect! Will be returning soon!

Great atmosphere, casual yet eclectic and homey, nice location.  Food was great , prices are reasonable great portions.  The Rissotto with bacon and artichoke was delicious.

Great casual ambience, friendly service and very good food. We had the octopus app to start which was very tasty and cooked well. The primi was the pappardelle with sweet sausage- delicious. We both had the specials for our main. I had the fluke and my wife had the chicken Milanese. Good sized portions and delicious. Prices are also a value with the wine list a true standout. Our Barolo was $48 and one of the pricier choices. Def a good pick.
Best pasta place around. Tastes just as good getting delivered as going there and it takes no time at all to get your food!

Awsome place.  Went there after a quick search on Yelp for a restaurant with outdoor seating on a nice day, right in the middle of prime time dinner.  Got a seat outside pretty easily.  Service and food were both excellent.  We enjoyed the food, and the portions were just right.  I hope to go back soon.
Phenomenal!!  The pappardelle with sweet sausage and truffle was close to the best Italian dish I've ever had!  Everything about this place was 5 star, all at reasonable prices!

The best pasta place in the city! Their specials are great, their seafood ravioli are to die for! They charge $15 per plate on average. It is a great place for a dinner-date or for a family celebration. The staff is always nice; they take a great care of you but aren't annoying. A must go place for Italian food lovers!
Wasn't the best Fughi Ravioli in town but not bad. Up to per. Okay wine selection. Deco was okay. Meh in Bushra scales.

this place has good food yes, but the service has been terrible from the moment we stepped inside. my reservation was made but they refused to seat us until my entire party arrived, even though six of us were there and we were waiting on a seventh who was running late. by the time he showed up they had given our table to someone else after repeated threats. the waitress was terribly rude to us and refused to look at our menus and talked down about a foreign person who was dining with us, insisting that she could not serve someone who only knew how to point at the menu (he didn't know how to pronounce the food, so he thought it would be easier to point) they also refused to give us plates for our appetizers and bread and treated us as if we were children. long story short, the food was good, but the service was horrendous. will not return.

Reasonably priced and quite delicious. Very impressed with the menu, presentation, and flavor, and really don't have much to add in that respect that other reviewers haven't mentioned. He was a real downer to an otherwise excellent meal.
I go there for good and inexpensive Italian food. Always a happy meal there. 5 stars for service. Nice ambiance.
It's the closest place to an Italian trattoria in NY. Molto bene!

We walked into this place without reservations on a Friday night.  It was tasty and tasteful.  The penne bolognese and the pappardelle with truffle oil was delicious.  Service attentive.  It wasn't all that expensive either.  Pasta delicious were around $14 and very yummy.

Great neighborhood Italian joint.  The handmade pasta was fresh and tasty, prices were surprisingly low, and service was attentive and friendly.  As another reviewer said: nothing fancy, just very solid.  Be sure to ask for the flat buns baked fresh, served with prosciutto and parmesan.  Definitely worth visiting if you're in the west village.

This place was decent. Would I come back? Probably not. The bread basket was mediocre at best. I shared the grilled calamari appetizer with a friend. There were four small pieces of calamari with a small side salad. For the entree, I got the papparadelle with meat ragu and truffle oil. It was fine but kind of one note. It was the kind of dish where after 5 bites you're kind of bored. The atmosphere was nice with the exposed brick. It's an okay italian place to go to if you're in the area.

In the fast pace concrete jungle of New York City, Da Andrea is an absolutely wonderfully refreshing breeze of rustic homey Italian food that will not put a dent in your wallet.  This quaint establishment serves a wide array of wonderful appetizers, homemade pastas, and tasty entrees.  Their complimentary focaccia is extraordinary and their desserts are great.  I've visited this restaurant more than a handful of times and it has yet to disappoint.  I highly recommend this joint for your next craving of Italian food!
I just had a lovely meal.  Yes the food was delivered very quickly, as was the check, but it was perfectly prepared delicate pasta accompanied by very attentive service.

Everything about this restaurant reminds me of a warm, Italian home. It's decorated simply with comforting colors. The food is abundant and delicious. I've never left the restaurant less than abundantly full. My top recommendations would be the tower of grilled veggies with cheese (though it's hard to cut thereby being hard to share... so I guess you just have to have an entire one to yourself), gnocchi with gorgonzola (smelly but cheesy), and artichoke ravioli (haven't seen that anywhere else!). The food comes out quickly and the servers are very nice. It's also great for medium sized parties - they don't add their own gratuity which is nice since you can really highlight their good service. Great place.

A cute neighborhood Italian restaurant.  I thought the appetizers were better than the entrees... at least the pasta ones I tried.   The meat dishes might be a better option but if you want pasta the pasta bolognaise looked pretty good.  Good service, reasonable prices, decent food.
One of my faves!! A great, cozy Italian restaurant, with great good and staff.

Italian restaurants don't often surprise me. This place did, in a very good way (until an air-conditioner broke down). Highlights- the much discussed prosciutto with flat buns (although at the end of the day I still like my jamon better); the mussel appetizer, which had a sweet, rich broth; the ravioli with veal and spinach, which came in a splendid white sauce with mushrooms and more prosciutto; and the pappardelle with veal and truffle oil. Each of the last three smelt like heaven when they arrived. Our only regret was that the heat made it impossible to enjoy a dessert as well!

After a less than stellar service related experience in October of last year, we put Da Andrea in the penalty box for a while.  Finally, at the request of my father, we decided to make amends and return to Da Andrea once more, and let me tell you, redemption tastes incredible.  From the le tigelle and cozze, to the pappardelle, cavatelli and lamb shank, every bite of food was absolutely phenomenal.  Our (new-ish?) waitress was outstanding and despite being packed, made us feel as if we were the only table in the restaurant.  This is the Da Andrea that those of us who followed them from their old Hudson street digs knew and loved.  Welcome back!  It took you a while to get your groove back, but it's nice to have you again.

Honestly, this is one of my favorite restaurants in the city.  I can't think of another Italian restaurant in New York with better value, given Da Andrea's amazing yet affordable food.  The atmosphere is perfect, and the service is extremely friendly.  I go here once every couple months or so and will definitely continue doing so!

My wife and I used to eat here every Sunday before we moved out to the burbs, so it was a treat to be back.  You must start with the Tigelle and prosciutto and pair it with the tomato-motz salad.  Put them together for an amazing appetizer sandwich - best with a party of four.  It's always hard to decide between the risotto specials and the fresh pasta dishes, but you really can't go wrong.  The veal-ravioli with mushrooms in cream sauce is decadent, but worth it - and the parpardelle with bolognese is excellent also.  Skip dessert and hope they bring you a plate of complementary cookies with a dipping sauce that's as addictive as crack cocaine - nice way to end things up.  The waitstaff hasn't changed in the decade we've been going, and neither have the prices.  For a casual weekday meal with friends, this place can't be beat.
Da Andrea was good.  I really like the way the restaurant is set up, it's very cozy and cute.  It's on a quiet street, so when the sidewalk patio is open, it's really nice.   Overall, pretty quality.

Tried their veal and spinach ravioli with mushrooms and prosciutto - amazing. Highly recommended. The mixed berries in warm zabaione in puff basket is lovely too. Stay away from the chocolate cake though - it's strangely reminiscent of Little Debbie.
I'm not a fan of italian food but the tapas here were yummy..more importantly, the service was great and the ambience is nice and homey..we'll be back again :)
Great gnocchi. Fantastic prices. Quaint space. Perfect location. I have no complaints about Da Andrea.

Had my bday dinner here.  It is a quint place in the middle of greenwich village.  Everything on the menu is very reasonably priced.  Can't beat 7 dollars Prosecco! I had the squid ink linguini pasta with seafood in it.  It was OK.  The best black linguini pasta I had was still at Babbo.  Overall the experience is good, but our waiter had a little bit of attitude, and I didn't get the jokes he was trying to make.  Not funny.

Upon coming to Da Andrea, you must understand what type of restaurant it is. It is not the type of place that is going for that "wow factor" by any means, rather, you are coming here for some straight simple home cooked Italian food. You are not exactly being transported to a trattoria in Umbria or some other region of Italy, but you can certainly appreciate the fact that almost all of the pasta is handmade, and the lamb shank that I ordered got the job done as I felt no need to dessert. It also helps that the price is right, but the wine by the glass option left something to be desired (Merlot or Montepulciano for the reds, didn't bother to ask about the whites). That said, if you are hungry and are looking for a place in the immediate area, Da Andrea is not a bad option, but I probably wouldn't consider it to be reservation/night out worthy.

Reviews are all about context and experience. This is an entirely fine place, I'd recommend it and I'd even go back... but it's not amazing if you've been to some of the city's a-list spots because, obviously, it's not one. That said, they're an ok place with fine service and it's very affordable. In this highly competitive resto-town, hats off to the average Italian place staking its claim and holding fast. Not easy.

Huge fans! Huge! Denny and I loved Da Andrea back in the day when it was on Hudson Street and we, of course, followed it over to 13th Street. Thankfully the charming staff is the same, the service is wonderful and you feel welcomed when you arrive. But the food---it's outstanding! The ingredients are always super duper fresh and all the dishes are cooked just perfectly. Everything's excellent but Den and I especially love the warm octopus salad, grilled calamari, squid ink tagliolini with clams, and the papardelle with sausage with the most marvelous touch of truffle oil. And what's more, it's very, very affordable. Hands down, it's the best Italian for miles and Denny and I can never get enough of this place. Da Andrea....Da Licious!

Reasonably priced Italian in the west village - the restaurant is clean but kind of lacks atmosphere.  The staff is friendly.  I wasn't wowed by their pastas or risottos - but they are definitely good.  It can get packed because it's a good deal - so expect a wait.

Wow. I wanted to find a delicious Italian place in the village, and this place took the cake. The restaurant is small, warm, inviting, and best of all the pasta was so delicious. I had the papardelle with sausage and my friend had the hanger steak. I think it would be a great first date spot but there were all types of diners there.
